what you would do. Stab me maybe? I really wouldn't doubt it given the

On Fri, 31 Jan 1997, Randy C Cone wrote:

> On Fri, 31 Jan 1997 blkadder@value.net wrote:
> 
> > 
> > I'm sorry I must be confused, I thought that you were the moron stating
> > that someone brought a stabbing upon themselves. 
> 
>  Well, you seem to be quite capable of making imfalmatory statements 
> without backing them up. Care to explain why you think I'm a moron?  

Sure. 

You are perfectly willing to pass judgement on others based on rumors. You
make statements based on those rumors. You make the statement, as you
reiterate below, that someones words somehow allow for  *physical*
violence upon a person, almost as if it is an expected thing. All of this
without the benefit of any real knowledge of what occured.   


> 
> > 
> > I much rather be considered immature than to hold such a fucked up
> > attitude.
> 
>  I fail to see what you consider a fucked up attitude. TT claimed he was 
> going to kill someone. He already knew he was dealing with some sketched 
> people.

No, it would be more accurate to say that you *HEARD* that he claimed he
was going to kill someone. Do you know this person so well as to know the
people he was dealing with, and what was going on besides some second hand
story you got from "someone who knew someone who heard something?" I
don't.  

>  I think you may be confused a bit. The grammer and spelling would 
> indicate that you have been firing these posts off quickly (especially 
> your first one). 

I suggest you go up a couple of paragraphs and look at your own, if we are
going to enter into petty grammar discussions.

> I am not condoning the behavior of the people who hurt 
> TT. 

That is exactly what you are doing. What you are saying is little 
different than saying "Well, TT drove them to stab him."

>  However; if you point a gun at yourself and pull the trigger (assuming 
> of course you know what a gun can do) you have no one to blame but 
> yourself for being shot. You walk into the wrong neighborhood and start 
> shouting slanderous euphimisms you should expect to run into trouble.

And just what neighborhood are we in? Is this what our neigborhood is 
about now? People getting stabbed? Sorry, this isn't the neighborhood I
want to be any part of.

> 
>  Thomas called this upon himself. Period. He threatened people with 
> death. I'm not saying he deserved what he got (although karmically...?) 
> but he is responsible for putting himself in a stupid and dangerous place.

Again, this is all conjecture. Which is what all your statements are
based on. 

>  It would be really nice BA if we could engage in a discussion about this 
> rather than you yelling and screaming and calling me names. But then you 
> must be so insecure that you can't, or your side of this issue is so weak 
> that you need verbal violence to give it any weight. It's amazing how 
> folks think that if they are loud enough then they are right. I guess 
> that is because a lot of folks believe the loudest person.

It is not insecurity or lack of validity that leads me to yelling or name
calling. It is sheer frustration that someone could hold what is in my
opinion such a misguided, inhuman, and uncompassionate view. Especially
amongst a group of people that usually seem to give a damn about one
another.

                                             Black Adder

 i don't feel so good,


 Well, besides being completly bitched at and called a moron in front of 
about 800 people (oh joy), I just recieved a phone call from Thomas 
Trouble (I really should have gone out tonight). This is going to be long...


 In my posts concerning the bust of the last GT parties, I had mentioned 
that rumor had that TT called the police. TT is _very_ upset by this, 
especially as he is not online and cannot respond. In the interest of 
fairness (and despite the fact I have to wake up for work in about 4 
hours) I am posting TT's report on some of the situations surronding this 
mess.

 TT had an argument with the russians (over DJ's) at the Karma 5 party. 
There was some hot words but TT denies saying "I'm going to kill...". His 
report is that the russians were upset and claimed they were going to 
kick his ass and his response was "we'll see whose ass gets kicked" 
(these words may be slightly off but not by much from what Tom said).

 His flat was robbed, he went to the warehouse and got most equipment 
back confronting (and beating up) two of the russians. He was still 
missing a CD burner. He talked with the parents of the two russians he 
got his other equipment back from, and they were concerned about police 
and their sons being deported.

 On Sunday the 26th (Jan.), TT drove up (to his flat?) and saw the other 
two russians. He hurried to talk to them and to let them know everything 
was all right. As he was talking to them he was struck several times and 
he tried to defend himself but a knife was pulled out. They didn't stab 
him once but 13 times. As he lay in a pool of blood, pretending to be 
dead, the russians got in their car and tried to run over him. Despite a 
knife wound in the neck to an artery he evaded the russians.

 He is getting stitches out on Sunday and will have lovely scars to show off.

 Tom swears that he did not call the police about the Stevenson 
warehouse. He swears on his mum and family. In fact he says he will give 
his sound system to anyone who can prove he called the police about 
Stevenson. Tom says that two of the russians (Eugene and Max) are willing 
to state that they believe Tom did not call the police. And that the 
reason the police came was because a power cable (damn them cables) was 
run to a neighboring warehouse which the police had checked earlier (that 
day or the day before GT I believe TT said).

 For my part I believe I said that the info I heard concerning all this 
was info told to me, rumors. However some people didn't see it that way 
and told TT I was telling everyone that he was responsible for the bust. 
If anyone can send me a copy of my posts concerning that it would be 
greatly appreciated. I just want to see how much shoe needs to be 
inserted into my mouth.


bye,

Ran D.Dreams

At 3:42 PM -0800 1/31/97, Larry Ching wrote:
> Again, I knew Noah had it wrong, but I, as an Asian-American male who
>grew up in Hawaii with less than 1% African-American representation
>at my high school, did not feel qualified to say exactly how and why
>Noah was off.

> Still and all, Noah's been a nice guy to me...

> Larry Ching / larryc@netcom.com

First off, I want to say I was disgusted at mr. Ruiz racist post. Just
shows how much real contact people have with African-American's in this
KKKountry.  More segregated than ever (there are studies that back this
stuff up, check them out).  I feel sorry for this KKKountry andd this
planet that has to deal with the constant assualt against people of color.
Fuck it, the world is getting browner, and I am thankful for that.

As for the content of Mr. Ruiz post, shows how FAR BEHIND the curve the
general public is when it comes to black slang OR ebonics.  Some of the
phraseology is SO OLD, that to speak in such terms would certainly label
you , er, "out-of-the loop".  You  can always tell when certain people
outside of a demographic interprets what they hear.  It probably took
whomever a whole year to put that tepid shit together.  Adn byt he time it
is put together the words and meanings have changed.  If people KNEW
anything about Africans's they would know this, but my suspiscion has
always been people DON'T care about Africans in this country so fuck 'em.
Especially if THEY can't take a joke.

Noah, get real, the terms are old.  Go to the, er, hood and check yourself
to some un-cut knowledge.  Who knows, dey might bust you off somethin'
proper.

I am glad that , like the minstrel shows of the past, you and other techno
weenies, find great humor in laughing at black vernacular.  We often
ridicule those things we understand least.  Like my anger at all of this
bullshit.  I can't wait for the sorry ass messages lebelling me a racist
for how I feel, or citing "hey he was only joking, lighten up!".  Well, I
will NEVER lighten up, I am black, don't wanna get no lighter, love the
melanin factor.  Muthafuckas gobblin' to get some, the shit so righteous.
Stop crackin' on my people, and I'll stop busting science.  For all you
pedants, "my people" are the human race, fuck that, IS the human race.
Here in this kkkountry, my people refers to ALL people of color, I want to
include everyone, but not everyone wants to be included.

As for Larry's comment, I can only say that I am sure there are people who
would've considered James Earl Ray, Byron Delabeckwith, Mr. Stoner, Jesse
Helms, and the ubiquitous senate virus Strom Thrumond as "nice guys".  Only
by virtue that they did nothing to them.  Shortsighted.  A man is judged by
the company he keeps.  I for one would never want to call any of the
aforementioned people my friends.  Nor any racist scumbag.  But, to each
his own.  Everyone makes thier own bed, and eventually must sleep in it.
Hope that nobody's burns in the process.

Out like Moses after the first rave,
John

P.S.  I hate those long sigs.

dear sfravers:

for those of you stuck in the walnut creek area there is a club on fridays
worth checking out.  it's called 'fusion' and it's at the 1220 club
at 1220 pine street, behind the 7-11.  house from 9pm-4am.  21+.
dj's raoul, pat allen + special guests.


i thought i might share something i found humorous from last week's
walnut creek journal, teen talk column.  the subject was "police are your
friends -- or not?"  

"Cops don't treat us fairly because it's hella not cool the way they be
yellin at us for being out past curfew or whatever.  They come up to 
us and try to kick us out of our own territory, you know.  It's hella messed
up.  They shouldn't do that to us.  I mean we're gonna be running the country
anyway, so they don't gotta be like buggin us".
- No Name, El Dorado Middle School

"Cops do treat teens fairly because, like, they're so nice to us.  When we're
walking down the street they'll like, stop the car and watch us walk and
talk to us.  Yeah, they're very fair".
- K., Carondelet High (a private girl's high school in Walnut Creek)

 i don't feel so good,


 Well, besides being completly bitched at and called a moron in front of
about 800 people (oh joy), I just recieved a phone call from Thomas
Trouble (I really should have gone out tonight). This is going to be long...


 In my posts concerning the bust of the last GT parties, I had mentioned
that rumor had that TT called the police. TT is _very_ upset by this,
especially as he is not online and cannot respond. In the interest of
fairness (and despite the fact I have to wake up for work in about 4
hours) I am posting TT's report on some of the situations surronding this
mess.

 TT had an argument with the russians (over DJ's) at the Karma 5 party.
There was some hot words but TT denies saying "I'm going to kill...". His
report is that the russians were upset and claimed they were going to
kick his ass and his response was "we'll see whose ass gets kicked"
(these words may be slightly off but not by much from what Tom said).

 His flat was robbed, he went to the warehouse and got most equipment
back confronting (and beating up) two of the russians. He was still
missing a CD burner. He talked with the parents of the two russians he
got his other equipment back from, and they were concerned about police
and their sons being deported.

 On Sunday the 26th (Jan.), TT drove up (to his flat?) and saw the other
two russians. He hurried to talk to them and to let them know everything
was all right. As he was talking to them he was struck several times and
he tried to defend himself but a knife was pulled out. They didn't stab
him once but 13 times. As he lay in a pool of blood, pretending to be
dead, the russians got in their car and tried to run over him. Despite a
knife wound in the neck to an artery he evaded the russians.

 He is getting stitches out on Sunday and will have lovely scars to show off.

 Tom swears that he did not call the police about the Stevenson
warehouse. He swears on his mum and family. In fact he says he will give
his sound system to anyone who can prove he called the police about
Stevenson. Tom says that two of the russians (Eugene and Max) are willing
to state that they believe Tom did not call the police. And that the
reason the police came was because a power cable (damn them cables) was
run to a neighboring warehouse which the police had checked earlier (that
day or the day before GT I believe TT said).

 For my part I believe I said that the info I heard concerning all this
was info told to me, rumors. However some people didn't see it that way
and told TT I was telling everyone that he was responsible for the bust.
If anyone can send me a copy of my posts concerning that it would be
greatly appreciated. I just want to see how much shoe needs to be
inserted into my mouth.


bye,

Ran D.Dreams

X-Mailer: Mozilla 3.0Gold (WinNT; I)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
CC: grigsby@ng.netgate.net
Subject: mostly NRR: No-Cost Moral Judgments
References: <Pine.BSI.3.95.970131225832.2987A-100000@value.net>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

I become very suspicious when anyone makes a moral pronouncement along
the lines of "Oh, you _ought_ to do this" or "No one should _ever_ do
that", or even "Everyone should do this" -- especially when the person
holding the opinion isn't required to do something beacuse of that
pronouncement.

Classic examples include "No one should ever have an abortion", often
spouted by 1) males and 2) happily married (and often no longer fertile)
older couples to whom it will never be an issue.

Ditto "Isn't that war in Bosnia horrible?", or "They should just put all
those gang kids in jail", or "Isn't violence horrible?", ... the list
goes on and on.

These tend to be what I call a "No-Cost Moral Judgment".  It wouldn't
cost me anything, as a male, to say I am against abortion.  It wouldn't
cost me anything, as a white guy with long hair, to make sanctimonious
pronouncements about "gangbangers".  It wouldn't cost me anything, as a
privileged white male with good income, to decry violence when I am not
in a position where violence or its threat is required for survival. 
And it doesn't even cost me anything to say I am against tropical
deforestation if I keep eating McDeathburgers and not recycling my
trash.

Making such a statement is simple ego-inflation.  It is saying "See how
nice and enlightened I am to know the truth in this situation?"  It
serves no other purpose.

So when I see pronouncements like:

> You are repeating rumors, and making judgements based on those rumors. A
> person, a *human being*, is lying in the hospital. *THAT* is fact. *THAT*
> is what matters.
> 
> There is no excuse for this. Period.
[snip] 
> Save your hypocrisy. Your lack of compassion and valuation of human life
> is pretty damn clear.

I think "Hmmm.  No-cost moral judgment."

There are a lot of other facts that you have chosen to discount because
you don't know them.  Probably no one ever will.  Therefore, I will
restrain myself from saying anything one way or the other, because I
can't add anything informed to the discussion.

I won't go to that space, either, but that's because of how unsafe
everyone has said it is.  Moot point for me either way.

// grigsbeast

On Sat, 1 Feb 1997, The Grigsbeast wrote:

> I become very suspicious when anyone makes a moral pronouncement along
> the lines of "Oh, you _ought_ to do this" or "No one should _ever_ do
> that", or even "Everyone should do this" -- especially when the person
> holding the opinion isn't required to do something beacuse of that
> pronouncement.

And you should be suspicious. I guess the important thing is to know if
the person making such pronouncments actually lives by their words in
order to make a value judgement.

> These tend to be what I call a "No-Cost Moral Judgment".  It wouldn't
> cost me anything, as a male, to say I am against abortion.  It wouldn't
> cost me anything, as a white guy with long hair, to make sanctimonious
> pronouncements about "gangbangers".  It wouldn't cost me anything, as a
> privileged white male with good income, to decry violence when I am not
> in a position where violence or its threat is required for survival. 
> And it doesn't even cost me anything to say I am against tropical
> deforestation if I keep eating McDeathburgers and not recycling my
> trash.
> 
> Making such a statement is simple ego-inflation.  It is saying "See how
> nice and enlightened I am to know the truth in this situation?"  It
> serves no other purpose.

I



> 
> So when I see pronouncements like:
> 
> > You are repeating rumors, and making judgements based on those rumors. A
> > person, a *human being*, is lying in the hospital. *THAT* is fact. *THAT*
> > is what matters.
> > 
> > There is no excuse for this. Period.
> [snip] 
> > Save your hypocrisy. Your lack of compassion and valuation of human life
> > is pretty damn clear.
> 
> I think "Hmmm.  No-cost moral judgment."

It is a simple matter to take comments out of context and then make
sweeping generalizations about them, isn't it?

There is no excuse for physical violence as a result of words. It happens
every day, yes. It is the same type of logic that defendants in rape cases
use: "Well, did you see the way she was dressed? She was asking for it." I
do not see the reason in this type of logic at all. I do not think it is
right. Actually, I think it is a pretty horrible.  

It may be as you say a "no-cost moral judgement." Cool, I just saved
myself 2 cents.

                                      Black Adder

well what can i say folks......a great party.  cool spot with space to sit down
if you could get around to it.

i could be found grooving most fasstidiously during the sets of carlos and spun
although i had to catch my breath from time to time.

although i still don't quite understand circle dancing (no disrespect i'm from
an earlier era) i had a great time. hope i didn't bug anyone by bumping my
booty.  it was nice and warm on the dance floor like i like it.  the vibe was
definately alive, but there were some non-believers so i had to turn to my
fellow neighbor and give a big fat smile and you know what? people were like
grinnin'.  i had to call it quits at 4:15 cause of an early wake-up call for
the thing i do during the day called work.

it's clubs/parties like that that make me wanna keep going to parties/clubs
like that..........

this was copied from a post i received today, sorry if you take offence
to the capital letters, but it is perhaps something that needs to be
yelled... loud and clear...



WE NOW HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO CHANGE....
EVERTHING.
WE ARE TIRED OF BEING TIRED
WE KNOW WHAT REALITY IS NOT THE SAME AS WE USED TO THINK ABOUT IT...IT
IS MALUABLE.

I DON'T WANT TO PERISH IN SOME WAR BROUGHT ON BY STUPID CONSUMERS BUYING
UP RESOURCES TRYING TO FIND TRUTH IN A BIG MAC...

I'VE HAD VISIONS THAT HAVE BROUGHT ME TO TEARS, DYING..ECSTASY...ETC
I WANT THESE BEAUTIFUL EXPERIENCES AND FRIENDS TO GROW AND REALIZE
THEMSELVES IN WAYS THEY DON'T YET REMEMBER ARE POSSIBLE.

AS MUCH AS YOU MAY THINK I'M FULL OF SHIT...
I'VE SEEN MANY FUTURES...THE ONE THAT WE MAY GET -WILL SUCK, BIG TIME.
ON THE OTHER HAND...THE BEST ONE I'VE SEEN...MAKES CELESTINE PROPHESIES
LOOK LIKE A BAD DAY AT WORK. 

NETWORKING IS THE HAND THAT TURNS THE KEY AND THE KEY IS LOVE.
LOVE FOR YOUR OWN EXPERIENCES AND ENVIRONMENT, LOVE FOR YOUR FRIENDS,
AND LOVE FOR JUST BEING ALIVE...

WHAT DO I DO? I'M JUST ONE PERSON....
WELL GET OVER IT...ONE PERSON ONE VOTE AND ONE E-MAIL LIST THAT CAN SEND
STUFF ALL OVER THE WORLD...GET IT YET?!
WHETHER YOU'RE E-MAILING OR TALKING OR DOING.

FIND WHAT WORK YOU REALLY LOVE DOING...TRADE IT FOR WHAT OTHER PEOPLE
WILL OFFER YOU. WHEN YOU LOVE SOMETHING ALOT IT BECOMES MAGICAL AND YOUR
ABILITY TO DO IT BETTER WILL MAKE YOU MORE VALUABLE TO OTHERS.AND YOU
WON'T BELIEVE PEOPLE WILL ACTUALLY PAY OR TRADE WITH YOU FOR YOUR
STUFF!!!!

WE ARE THE FUTURE OF THIS PLANET EITHER YOU'RE 6 FEET UNDER OR BUILDING
A NEW WAY OF INTERACTING WITH THIS STUFF CALLED REALITY...YOU'RE IT!

ALL THESE E-MAILS I'VE SENT YOU ARE TO BE READ AND SENT TO OTHERS. YOU
CAN ADD TO THEM IF YOU WISH. BUT REMEMBER...DO WHAT YOU LOVE...THAT IS
SYNERGY NOT COMPROMISE OR SACRIFICE. WE WANT YOUR STRENGTH.

WHO'S WE? YOU, ME ANYBODY WHO'S INTERESTED IN RED LINING PERSONAL
EXPERIENCE AND BELIEVE IN FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION, RESPECT, PLAY AND LIFE.

THIS IS A CULTURAL VIRUS. THE INTENT IS CLEAR:
THROUGH THE RE-ORGANIZATION OF BEING IN A PARALLEL NETWORK SYSTEM OF
RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, WE CAN GROW, DIVERSIFY AND EXPAND OUR ABILITIES,
PEACE OF MIND AND SAVE OURSELVES FORM OUR OWN STUPIDITY.

YOU CAN KILL THIS VIRUS IF YOU WISH BY NOT PARTICIPATING IN IT.

BUT BEFORE DOING SO...IN THE END... DO YOU REAlLY BELIEVE THAT
GOVERNMENT AS WE HAVE SEEN IT... SUPPORTS YOU?... OR SUPPORTS CORPORATE
POWER BROKERS, ABSTRACT FINANCIAL PROFITS AND WASTE.

DID YOU KNOW THAT THERE IS AN ENGINE THAT RUNS ON WATER? 
IT USES ELECTRICITY TO SPLIT WATER INTO HYDROGEN AND OXYGEN... THEY ARE
THEN RECOMBINED IN THE COMBUSTION CHAMBER AND GIVE OFF STEAM AS EXHAUST.

IMAGINE EACH HOUSEHOLD WITH IT'S OWN INDEPENDENT POWER and vehicle THAT
USES A NATURAL RENEWABLE RESOURCE AND GIVES OFF AN EXHAUST YOU CAN
DRINK?

THIS AIN'T BULLSHIT...CHECK IT OUT ... we are being manipulated: TO KEEP
CORPORATE STRUCTURES IN CONTROL AND MAKE MONEY.

EVERYONE WOULD BENEFIT EXCEPT PEOPLE WHO MANIPULATE FOR SELFISH
GROTESQUE GAIN AT THE COST OF PEOPLE AND THE PLANET. 

IF YOU WANT A DIFFERENT FUTURE, START THE VIRUS-IT'S ABOUT FREEDOM.

NOT CAPITALISM SOCIALISM OR FASCISM. IT'S ABOUT LIFE.



another quote perhaps relevant is age-old Roman emperor Marcus Aerulius

"WASTE NO TIME ARGUING WHAT A GOOD MAN SHOULD BE, BE ONE!"



political bantering is a waste of time... whether it's about violence,
thoughts on violence, language or who stole the cable...

we have found ourselves in the midst of a culture, who for the first
time in ages, was seemingly pushing itself forward through mutual
support and respect...  are we now bursting at the seems with ego,
hostility and competition...?

the key is throwing the rule-book away and getting on with life, not
getting caught up in the semantics of the game...

peace and love, light and life...

yeah, all that hippie shit...


the alchemist

From: BRUCE ALVIN MCDONOUGH <glow@sfsu.edu>
Message-Id: <199702021041.CAA21663@orion.sfsu.edu>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: Problems considered...
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

anyways, i agree, things seem a little 'hairy', especially reading this
list the last couple weeks.  1997 has brought some bad vibes, starting with
all the busts and such...  i think everyone needs to drop a hit and think
things out a little.  i think the problems really come down to greed,
people can make a quick (untaxed) buck by throwing together a party, not
worrying about permits, safety, health, toilet paper, ventilation,....and
have a venue to peddle some drugs (in my experience, usually inferior or
worse).
after almost 4 years, i definitly feel like a vet, and all this talk about
unity is very transitory.  it's rare to meet someone more than twice, and
promotors and djs come and go.  the unity generally lasts a few hours.  But,
those few hours can really change peoples lifes.
what this scene needs is one (or a small group) of dedicated promoters to
get it together and get the required permitted space and do it right.  they
could still keep it pretty underground in their methods of promoting, make
a few bucks, and do everyone a favor.  maybe we should call Steve Jobs up?
the nature of SF (imho) is very flaky, and 'the rave scene' reflects this
well.  i've met *hundreds* if not a 1000 people here, and maybe 5 i can call
'friends' at this point, and i'm not a bad dude, really.
maybe we could be friends??
Bruce

"a smiling face
 it means the world to me..
 so tired of the sadness
 and the misery
 yeah!
" Ozzy Osbourne singing for the venerable Black Sabbath, circa 1975

On Sun, 2 Feb 1997, BRUCE ALVIN MCDONOUGH wrote:

> list the last couple weeks.  1997 has brought some bad vibes, starting with
> all the busts and such...  i think everyone needs to drop a hit and think
> things out a little.  i think the problems really come down to greed,
> people can make a quick (untaxed) buck by throwing together a party, not
> worrying about permits, safety, health, toilet paper, ventilation,....and
> have a venue to peddle some drugs (in my experience, usually inferior or
> worse).

yes, i would have to agree that a lot of people are greedy really without 
knowing it.  but i always try to look at it from their perspective, 
because if we are to actually enact any kind of change, we must first 
understand the promoter's point of view, without bias, as well as the 
partygoers point of view.  

That's for each of us to decide in our own minds what those points of 
view are for at least a day before posting on SFR what our answers are.  
Here's why:

We all need to learn to listen to each other.  You see, a lot of us think 
we listen to people, but what actually happens is we just take turns 
talking.  This especially happens in live conversation.  We live in a 
society where people are attention starved and RECOGNITION starved.  Try 
this sometime.  Instead of waiting for a hole to pop up so we can insert 
our comments in a conversation with someone (this could be on or off the 
list, it doesn't matter), listen to everything they say, you'll notice 
they'll run out of things to say on their own, nod attentively, smile a 
little bit while nodding a little bit, take mental note of what they have 
to say, acknowledge their point of view, and be excited for them.  

Of course, this is basic for a lot of people's programming.  But there 
are a lot of people stuck.  Some of us might be reading this post right 
now thinking "he's full of baloney" or "well this might work for some 
people, but personally i'm above all this personal growth stuff" If this 
is true, we may have more to gain from reading this post over and over 
again than those not reviewing their ego-based "I understand everything", 
also known as the "know it all" program.  

Egos serve a purpose.  They are like a shield we use to protect our true, 
sensitive selves.  But it can also cut us off from sharing appreciation, 
recognition, and general love for each other.  It sometimes causes us to 
misinterpret points of view based on lack of information due to lack of 
listening and start a negative chain reaction.  

more later.  tired.  

blonde bondage sheets.  next oprah windbag...

> Hi all, Eric here again.  OK, I'm gonna buy this thing.  Went and played with
> one yesterday (whew!) hands twitchin just thinking about it.  My next question
> is if anyone out here can recommend a place with a good price?  I went to K&K
> in San Jose, I can get one there for about $1000.00 anyone have a better price?
> I'm dying in anticipation...help.

Most of the retailers in the bay area are selling the Pioneer gear for way
too much. I got mine back in April 96 (prices might be different now):
	* CDJ-500mkII	(CD deck -- $599.99 ea) 
	* M-500		(mixer -- $799.99 ea)

I got it via mail order from NY at J&R Music and Computer World
1-800-221-8180. In addition to the very good prices on most equipment,
you save on 8.25% sales tax, but you have to pay 3% shipping/insurance.

Anybody buying computer/software/audio/photo/video/lighting/home-electronics
should check these guys out -- call the number above and have them send
you a catalog. They'll definitely save you some $$ on big ticket items.
Also, on many items, they're willing to haggle over prices -- try it
and see if you can get them to come down a few more percent.
Unfortunately other than the pioneer equipment, all they sell for
club/dj audio is Gemini/Numark/Carver, which we all know is crap.

>> The four Russian guys who run the Space on Stevenson  (Galactic Tunnel)
>> are violent judging from the stab wounds on Thomas Trouble. This space
>> should be avoided.

Hmm, from the sound of it, it seems SF has a Peter Gatien dilemma on their
hands.  For those who don't know, Peter Gatien was a big New York City club
promoter who ran clubs like the Limelight, the home of the Wednesday night
Disco2000 which made DJ Keoki ever so (in)famous.  Plus I believe he ran
several nights at the re-opened Tunnel.  Anyway to make a short story even
shorter, he decided that the fame and fortune of being one of the central
people behind the Club Kid scene in NY wasn't enough for him.  As it turns
out he was running a fairly organized drug dealing operation.  He'd have the
door people at his clubs selectively bust the dealers going in that weren't
selling his drugs for him.  Well, NYPD finally got him on it and he's now in
jail.  The bust came around some murder charge that one of his underlings
got themselves into.  The kid narked on Peter Gatien in attempts to get
himself off of the murder charge.  Well, unfortunately for the kid, the
murder charge and the drug trafficking charge are completely unrelated
legally and NYPD got their murderer AND Peter Gatien!

I'm sorry to hear Thomas Trouble has been injured.  I hope he gets well
soon.  In my eyes, nobody ever deserves to be physically harmed for any reason.

He all!

Last night a couple of friends of mind through this party Clearspace here 
in san Luis Obisbo.  I would say it was the biggest party i've seen here 
in this area.  Approx 800 ppl.  The space was a ware house in Paso Robles 
fairgrounds.  I'm stll tired from that party and studing all day today so 
sorry if i seem blunt.  
     The space had a 2200 cappacity so it looked small but it was very 
fun, for as long as it lasted...   The chill space by sputnik was cool 
and very one was very cool and happy.  Dj dan and "freaky chakra"  were 
not able to come but they posted that tomas michael and simply jeff 
aggred to spin too.  i missed the first dj probably Diego-v ( a 
local/promoter) went first.  Then Radley marx came next and got the crowd 
pumpin'.  I couldn't stop dancing, i need to work out all my tentions 
after mid-terms friday.  Everyone was dancing, I was very iimpressed on 
how many people I met from LA and SF that came down for the party, they 
were all great people.  I'm sorry though that it got broken up.
    Trance went after Radley and started off slow, a little too much 
trippy trip hop to dance to and moved more into his usual funky trance.  
An hour or so into his set (3.00am)  paso robles police came in and shut 
the party down.  They were getting noise complants all night since 11.00 
pm and said they couldn't let the party go on.  What I thought was really 
cool was that one of the officers got on a mic gave a small speech about 
the party and scene in general.  The made it clear that they would have 
kept the party going had nobody complained.  There was no violence and 
eveery one was very positive and they approved of the way the party was 
handled.  Everyone in the building started cheering and clapping.  YEAH!
	Well a few people in slow offered many people back to their 
houses to crash or continue parting.  Skark-e had MANY MANY people come 
by as well as a few other friends of mine had house parties till dawn. 
 The promoters are supposted to throw a free after party tonight but I got too
 much stuff to do tomorrow (more mid-terms - ahh!)  The only negative 
thing I heard last night was that m friend Josh got his back pack stolen. 
(Claire.  Did Josh ever find it?  Let me know.  i'm glad you had fun in LA!)
There are more smaller parties planed for the future and I hope we can 
create something numinious and fun down here.  (I love that word).
Peace all-


PLUR,

       Austin

At 9:44 PM -0800 1/31/97, Uncle Noah wrote:
>So anyway, let me post the question to SFRAVES since the topic is
>breached:
>
>WHY is the techno/rave scene as we know it today so exclusionary toward
>African Americans, especially in the inner-city?  True, the junglists are
>starting to bridge the gap and break and opening to the scene, but that
>does not really answer the question.

I think it has alot to do with where techno is today vs. where it was in
the mid 80's. I think that there always has been a dance culture in
African-American history (one thing that NOBODY could take away).  But I
think that 140bpm and above is not really danceable, and danceability is
crucial to acceptance IMO.  Just a possibility.

>The scene, he continued, appealed to Chicanos/Latinos, but not the African
>Americans.

I think hi-nrg music appeals to Latino/Chicano's because it's rhythm
structures are based on a latin rhythm subtext.  Ramp it up a few BPM's and
you may well exclude many african's from catching a groove.  Besides the
fact I think it may be still seen as too latin rhythm oriented and thus the
avoidance (yep, we as a country are really screwed in this sense.  got
brown against brown, the man has achieved the ultimate).

>Now all this happened about a week after URB released its issue with the
>'history' of techno.  If you missed it, URB pretty much stated that techno
>is an African American art form, produced for and by a community
>interested in communicating the toils of inner city life (Hello Goldie?
>j/k)

Faux Pas here Uncle.  There is a tendency (I was guilty as well at one
point), of grouping all people of African descent together.  The
experiences of Africans in england are far different than those of Africans
in America.  Same for Africans in teh Carribiean, and Africans in Africa.
Each group is linked by a common bond, thier African genetics, but then it
diverges from there.  There are Billions of blacks that have no slave
ancestors, there are blacks who did not undergo the persecution that
Africans in America faced.  Same for my carribiean brothers and sisters.
We all have different politicial and social realities.  Goldy may well
resonate in Brixton, but may fall on deaf ears in the Bronx.  Same for
Tricky.  Hey I like those guys, and believe they are creative and love
their music, but NWA or Jungle Brothers, or Pharcyde resonate with me much
more than anything that comes over the Atlantic (except for Fela, King
Sunny Ade, etc.).  Things lost in translation?  I dunno.  I think Jungle
has a disticnt chance of bridging that gap.

>So what are we doing wrong??
>Obviously, posting racists jokes could be one thing, but it doesn't
>explain why you go to a party with a couple of hundred people and find the
>limited demographics you do...
>
>thoughts?

I think it's endemic of the problem overall.  There is a basic lack of
understanding.  People don't understand why I could be so upset at the word
gangstah and then ask "Gee, WHY aren't there any blacks at this party?".  I
think being sensitive to other peoples reality is a start.  Making the
music accessible (in many ways, BPM referenced) is another.  Bringing in
the hip-hop contingent is another, something that has been avoided here in
the bay area.

There is plenty that can be done, for those with the courage to do it.

FLAVA '97.

Peace,
John

I went to my first ever rave on New Year's Eve completely straight.  I
think I enjoyed it much more than I would have if I had dropped anything.

Anyway, if you're running out of steam at 3am, there's always caffeine.
If you're averse to that, try an Odwalla honey lemonade or Serious Ginseng;

'till dawn under fruit juice power alone.  You'll have to ask others
about Ma Huang and its ephedra cousins...

Received: from adeskgate.autodesk.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.8.4/V2.0) with ESMTP id RAA09832; Sun, 2 Feb 1997 17:31:58 -0800 (PST)
Received: from autodesk.autodesk.com by adeskgate.autodesk.com (8.6.12/SMI-5.3) with ESMTP id RAA06096; Sun, 2 Feb 1997 17:31:22 -0800
Received: from klaatu.autodesk.com by autodesk.autodesk.com (8.6.12/4.4BSD) with ESMTP id RAA11885; Sun, 2 Feb 1997 17:31:05 -0800
Received: (from robertr@localhost) by klaatu.autodesk.com (8.7.5/8.7.3) id RAA14371; Sun, 2 Feb 1997 17:31:04 -0800 (PST)
Date: Sun, 2 Feb 1997 17:31:04 -0800 (PST)
From: Rob Rayle <robertr@autodesk.com>
Message-Id: <199702030131.RAA14371@klaatu.autodesk.com>
To: SFRAVES@hyperreal.com, yoslayer@hotmail.com
Subject: Re: Sober raving
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


> Hey so like last night night I did it again! I raved sober. IT was great.
> I think I rave better sober  and have more fun, I meet more people and
> make more friends.Pretty good so far right? So I want to rave sober
> more often but around 2 or 3in the morning I run out of steam.  Does
> anyone have any good healty suggestions on how I can keep my
> energy and vibe going past 3:00 am without drugs? Somebody send me
> a magic recipe please.


	About 10:30 or 11 pm before/during a rave I generally have a 
smoothie containing about 50g of protein from various supplements 
(egg, whey, soy, <no meat, but I'm no vegan either>), 5g of synthetic
creatine monohydrate (important nutrient naturally found *only* 
in red meat that is an important factor in your ability to 
store energy in your muscles - basically all pro athletes use this 
supplement these days), 1.5g of vitamin C. I throw in some OJ and a 
bunch of fresh fruit (strawberries, blueberries, bananas depending on 
the season). Usually take some vitamins at this time also - B complex 
or niacin for sure, maybe some calcium, zinc, and/or E (the vitamin!)
as well. It's not difficult for me to stay up dancing all nite.

	This isn't a cheap drink, but it's cheaper than a hit of E 
(the drug!), I think anyway - one of my studio clients tells me that E
goes for $20 a hit these days - is that right? Jeez...


	I also have a regular program of exercise that includes 
aerobics & weight training. I don't really know how much good 
the supplement alone will do, but I doubt anyone could sleep for 
at least four hours after one of these things. The fructose kicks 
in right away, and by the time that's gone you're burning the protein 
for energy if you're dancing.

	I'm a coffee drinker, but coffee before a rave doesn't
work for me. I find that the caffiene crash 4-5 hours later will
drain my energy for the rave every time. On the other hand, 
a little Chai after 1am or so can help ...

Congrats! I've been noticing more and more reports similar to yours.

> So I want to rave sober 
> more often but around 2 or 3in the morning I run out of steam.  Does 
> anyone have any good healty suggestions on how I can keep my 
> energy and vibe going past 3:00 am without drugs? Somebody send me
> a magic recipe please.

Well, I've noticed that eating a lot of fruit throughout the party
keeps me awake and energetic for the entire night (and also helps my
sleep more refreshing). Starting the night with a protein-powder laden
fruit smoothie also helps prepare your body for a long night of
dancing.

Another thing that helps is taking a half hour or an hour cat nap at
some point during the night. I don't always do this, but when I do,
I'm usually okay to dance until about 9 or 10 the next morning.

Another suggestion is to use your breaktime (ie. resting from dancing)
to rest your legs and re-hydrate, but avoid sitting on the floor and
slowly easing into comfort-land. You'll find that by forcing your
breaks to be productive (ie. stretching your muscles and drinking some
water), it will keep you from settling into a comfy corner and losing
all inspiration to keep moving.

And if all else fails, look for the Nub! Chai has the wonderful effect
of loosening your body and clearing your mind (great for dancing) while
providing you with that special caffeine boost (great for keeping awake).
A cup of Chai really goes a long way.

Hope this helps, and good luck.

from your favorite happy sober raver,
Steve

--

An awe-struck THANK YOU to Koinonea for that beautiful, beautiful party 
last night.  _Clean_ space, amazing artwork everywhere, Chai tea hut 
(ummm!), bananas-and-oranges just when I needed them, many grooving 
drummers, a random flutist, people melting on massage tables, the dance 
floor pounding all night with the boundless soul-energy of goa trance, and 
even a breathtaking contortionist, gracefully bending to the music like a 
moving meditation.  And of course, all the people...

It was rejuevenation to me.  Last I danced was two weeks ago, but somehow 
it felt like it had been too long, and the night passed in a daze and I 
came out of it wrung through with sweat and exhaustion...a 4-hour 
work-out in a sauna...a deep body experience to restore me to myself. 

Sober raving meant our night ended when our bodies could go on no more, 
around 4AM.  But this time I actually _remember_ the names of those I 
met, and, though the sober experience is different, it is just as fulfilling.

Til next time!
Love,
n

Regarding sober raving,

While in London over the summer I became fond of the new boom in "energy
drinks" such as Red Bull (Virgin had a brand but I can't remember what they
called it) and there were numerous others. Caffeine was a major ingredient,
but there were others that made it nicer than coffee or Jolt or Mtn Dew.
These soft drinks were quite popular at clubs and helped to go all night when
avoiding other substances. They took off so well there (even sold in 6packs
at supermarkets) I'm surprised they haven't made their way over here yet,
especially since the bars have to stop the alcohol at 2AM - these cans of
soft drinks helped  in the revenue dept as well.

juliet   :)

Sure, I sometimes wonder how many around me are dancing sober or on E -
not that it's a huge deal. Last night at Koinonea (which was simply
amazing!) I had a rare glimpse into a *statistic* of sorts.

While I was dancing, a young woman came up to me, with a smile and a warm
touch of reassurance, and asked "Are you on Ecstacy?" After I answered
her, she went on to the person dancing next to me and asked the same
question in the same way. I saw him shake his head no, returning her 
smile. I was curious why she was asking the question, of course, but I
became even more interested in what kind of answers she was getting. 

So after about the fifth person, I simply asked her this, with the same
smile and touch of reassurance. She dismissed my question by moving on to
the next person, which was fine (although I admit that I was intrigued
by her mission, whatever it was). 

But I was even more curious about the responses she was getting, so I
watched her rounds, as she asked almost everyone in the room. The yes or
no answers were fairly clear from the nods and head-shakes, without having
to hear their words. I counted three affirmatives and about fifteen
negatives before I lost her in the crowd.

>From the vibe of the Koinonea crowd, I would have guessed that same 5-1
ratio (yeah yeah, I know this isn't a very accurate poll), although those
who believe the current media hype about DRUGS AT RAVES probably would be
surprised that *everyone* there wasn't on E.


- Rp

For those of you who care, I am sooo psyched to be moving out there!

I know you all have problems with the scene, but this past friday guess
what happenned to me: I was at this really *nice* party Dan Efex record
release party "RELEASED". It was a very positive party and all around good
time. Until around 4:30a, when I was at the smart bar talking with the
smart drink guy and this security guard (cop?) handcuffed me and took both
of us to the store front next door. There, these three guys grilled us and
took all of our stuff. They proceeded to negotiate "bond" money. I told
them I only had $60 until next Friday, so they asked for $30. I gave them
$40, they gave me change. Then they gave me ALL [;)] of my stuff back
(except my bowl and an e) which they kept. Odd, one of the DJs (I won't
name publicly) was hanging out with these crooks.

The good peeps here in Chicago (like Dan and some others) are working to
straighen all of this out. I think it's FUBAR. I posted that I boycott
Chicago parties, from now on. I will only go to little and/or smaller town
parties. :D

Goin' to California,
 m

> While in London over the summer I became fond of the new boom in "energy
> drinks" such as Red Bull (Virgin had a brand but I can't remember what they
> called it) and there were numerous others. Caffeine was a major ingredient,
> but there were others that made it nicer than coffee or Jolt or Mtn Dew.
> These soft drinks were quite popular at clubs and helped to go all night when
> avoiding other substances. They took off so well there (even sold in 6packs
> at supermarkets) I'm surprised they haven't made their way over here yet,
> especially since the bars have to stop the alcohol at 2AM - these cans of
> soft drinks helped  in the revenue dept as well.
> 


they're on the east coast... it seems new products flow west... unless
they were generated out west to begin with... they'll probably be
happening by the year's end...


dave

in advance I'd like to apoligize for any typos, or gramatical errors that
will soon follow but I need to vent so I'm just gonna let go. And hey it's
probably about time that I said "HI !" and introduced myself.  I'm James
those of you on here that have gone to a few massives might know me or some
of you longer term members might recognize me to I've been into raveing for
aproxamatly 3 years and I'm trying to figure out how to educate a massive
especcialy with the expected influx of newbies (a la 20/20) in the 14- ??
range I expect this to really show at love affiar.  a majority of these are
going to be so utterly cluless about whats going on ( Mainly refering to thug
or at least that's where >I< think the problem arises) that it would be a
good Idea to set up an information service I've been on this list for allmost
a month now and I read every message and really like the bent of your beliefs
so I ask for help the information booth will be run by me in the 2 wks.
aprox. that I have I'd like you all to talk to your friends and pass the word
on about the booth and encourage any newbies to stop by  I'm thinking of
calling it 
are ya ready ;)

                                    JUST SAY KNOW

I'm gonna have my friend do a  grafatti art style banner with the letters
being drawn so that they resemble a large varity of drugs in those colors
that we all know and love sooooo muuuuchhhh under those darklights. so I'll
be hard to miss.  I'd like on a longer term to start a political movement not
to leagalize drug use but instead to regulate those who sell them by
licenceing them and enforceing strict education standards for these people
these people then would have the legal right to sell drugs to any legal adult
or to an adolesent or a child if precribed by a doctor, shrink or apropriate
responsable athority ( I feel I must state that I don't consider our Current
goverment to be responsable athority) i can't see any deeper then that right
now.  what I'd like to do now is to collect some samples from your friends
and with your assurance that they will honor the agreement I'll get it tested
at a lab and then I'll return to you a laminated card designed indiviualy for
him or her with all the appropreate(sp?) information and then have enlarged
posters of those cards in my booth as well as all the ACCURATE INFORMATION
that I can obtain and duplicate in time thus getting the newbies to stop by
and finding out what there in for and hopefully avoiding the complications of
new years cool world health fiasco.  I truly believe our scene is in need of
something like this at least at the massives cause it's to large and we can't
know everyone around us and that's hurting the vibe more then anything else
cause you then have distrust those around you at least a bit or inevitably
you end up getting something stolen bunked or just plain used by the way
those 3 things should be looked at IMHO as educational opertunities,  most
theives I've encountered have had a lack of respect for themselves so how can
we expect them to respect us or our property, they are under the normal
conditions of a party :)  rather easy to spot (i'm generizing I know but it's
gotta get out and I cant stop to order it out right)  and inevitably someone
gets hurt Vlad's won my respect on this in that he has prepared for these
eventualitys but he's agravating in that he dosn't seem to try to provide
education as a means of averting problems

I don't think anyone out their thinks this but I want to make it clear that
the purpose of the booth would not be to discourage drug use or encorage it
but simply inform those that ask what I've been told and believe to be
reliable for that to be worth a Shit though I'll need help gathering it all
and cross referenceing it and probably most importantly love not for anyone
in particular or even someone you know show it by teaching what you know to
those new and around you at this event if you can't connect to them on a
personal level then send them to the booth.  the beauty is that you really
don't have to work you just have to care I'll be accepting any help I can use

at this point though I could use some advice and some factual answers on a
few legal issues so that when I try and convince vlad to let me do this I
have the answers to some really obvious questions.


for the few the brave the truly bored that acctualy got this far my

suggestions you might have.

At 03:34 PM 2/2/97 -0800, you wrote:
>Hey so like last night night I did it again! I raved sober. IT was great.
>I think I rave better sober  and have more fun, I meet more people and
> make more friends.Pretty good so far right? So I want to rave sober 
>more often but around 2 or 3in the morning I run out of steam.  Does 
>anyone have any good healty suggestions on how I can keep my 
>energy and vibe going past 3:00 am without drugs? Somebody send me
>a magic recipe please.
>
>Peace out, James
>

Get enough sleep right before the party.  Whenever I plan rave sober I
usually stay up the night before then sleep the whole day before the party
and I take lots of vitamins and drink lots of sports drinks.   There is a
kind of bottled water in the market called Water Joes and it's caffiene
water.  It contains caffiene but tastes like water.  You should try this.

SLURP (starbursts, love, unity, respect, and peace)
Anthony E

On Fri, 31 Jan 1997, Uncle Noah wrote:

> 
> So what are we doing wrong??
> Obviously, posting racists jokes could be one thing, but it doesn't
> explain why you go to a party with a couple of hundred people and find the
> limited demographics you do...
> 

1) money

2) accessiblity

Raves appeal to young, suburban rebellion.  Usually suburban means white.
In order to go to raves you need 1-cash and 2-time.  This is usually
where youth come in who, being supported by their parents, are in a
unique experience similar to the bourgeoisie. When you don't
have a lot of money or have to work your ass off to pay the bills, raving
becomes quite the luxury, especially at $20 a pop (excluding your average
pharmocopia).

Raving may have been started by the AFrican American community, but it is
now dominated by the people who can afford it.

-KaySEE

I'd have to say that I am at my very best when I am in really good shape.
If I am exercising about 3 times a week I have tons and tons of energy.  I
danced hard one night until 6 a.m. feeling like this.  It felt great.
However, when I don't exercise I feel especially crappy and have no extra
energy to spare.  The difference is amazing.

On Mon, 3 Feb 1997, KC wrote:
> On Fri, 31 Jan 1997, Uncle Noah wrote:
> 
> > 
> > So what are we doing wrong??
that's good and observant observation, but if we want to clean up the 
rave scene and get rid of the scumbuckets, instead of concentrating on 
what we're doing wrong, why not concentrate on what we're doing right and 
try to duplicate that?  make sense?  success in anything is way way 
easier when we find out what everyone else is doing and do the exact 
OPPOSITE.  everyone else (especially people and news shows that don't 
even contribute to our scene) is taking a toothpick and a magnifying 
glass to find out what's wrong with us.  NOTHING  is wrong with us.  
We're just a group of happy-go-lucky bouncy people that like to listen 
and dance to intellegent dance music.  we like to watch the sun come up.  
if that's not good enough for them, too bad.  we are going to keep on 
truckin, as they say in alabama.  =]

> Raving may have been started by the AFrican American community, but it is
> now dominated by the people who can afford it.

well, that's true, but i've found "afford" a lot of times is an 
individual perception.  

what if we all boycotted gas until it came down to 69 cents per gallon?  
it would never happen, because there's still not enough believers...but 
what if?

Subject: ...And I stuck out like a Sore Thumb.
Date: Mon, 3 Feb 1997 09:31:59 -0800
X-Mailer:  Microsoft Exchange Server Internet Mail Connector Version 4.0.994.63

So I hope everyone is as well rested as I, and ready for yet another
glorious week...

(Heh)

Friday:  Well I took the day off and instead of rifling thru tons of
paperwork I stood in line form 8-10 AM and caught Star Wars.  While
watching the film a few friends of mine paged me and wanted to catch an
afternoon showing of... Star Wars.  So off to Santa Clara and a 2 PM
showing.  After lunch, and a few errands I was off to Redwood City to
rondevous w/ some other friends to catch a 7:30 showing of Star Wars.
(Can someone say Fanatico??).  I was dead tiredby 11Pm...

Saturday:  I must say if only one issue were cleared up, It would a been
a 10/10 Saturday...

My day really started @ 5:30PM when myself and a friend helped set up @
the _Koinonea_ event.  After spending a few hrs @ the site, myself and
Dhrien gruuved up to the mappoint and sold tickets from 9:30 till 11:30.
 I actually don't mind Mappoint because your not only get to see
everyone that's going to be @ the event, but you also help set the mood
of the party @ hand, and (possibly the best part) you KNOW the party
will be going OFF when you get there...
	And going OFF it was when D and I arrived back @ 12-or-so.  Anna was on
the 12" and playing some, well, really On Psi-trance. I was impressed on
how the sceansters themselves sorta reserved the back room for the
circle dancers. and the fron was wher the vibesters were playing...  I
jumped infront of a speaker and kept going...  I really enjoyed the
contorionist set during Ivo's set.  Hell, I really enjoyed Ivo's set!
He thru one or two tracks that really brought me to that higher state...
	Funny thing was, that while dancing three or so peoples asked me what I
was on while dancing I told them that I was pretty clean and that sorta
ended the conversations.  Dear ravers, some of us are "there" w/o drugs.
 I enjoy chatting, but you have ta pull me out of my reality first.  I
really don't mind...  What really got me to laughing was that allthough
I know I wasn't the only sober one, I guess us sober dancing maniacs
stick out like sore thums...
	My associates we're quite tired from setting up and dancing and such,
so we bailed early ( by my standards) @ 4:30.  Chilled out and 420'ed @
a friends house slept and spent a lovley sunday communing with nature @
one of my hidey hole beaches...

I really would like to thank the scensters for coming on down and
supporting the _Koinonea_ crew (And, no I STILL don't know how to
pronounce it...) and party.  At the same time I would like to express my
thanks to the _Koinonea_ family: Tom, Dhrien, Wonka, CT, and everyone
else who put thier trust in be to help out, set up, run mappoint and
have a killer good time.  Much love to all of you.

Saturday night, to me, is what the scene is about...  It's incidental
that it music was Goa.  I;ve caught the same vibe from Cyber-Trance to
House to Breakbeat events.  I love music, but love moreso the driving
force that gets these events going.

Respect,

---_Adam
"Stay Connceted"
>

Alas, I didn't tape it cos I aint got cable (or even very good non cable
reception for that matter!).

It was nice to get asked some reasonable questions and get (I beleive)
undistorted reponses that actually aired. The woman that produces show (not
the interviewer) goes to parties etc. and is really nice.

The woman that interviewed me had no idea what a rave was, but actually
spent about an hour before we taped asking me questions including the usual
litany of sex and drugs questions =) and seemed very interested. At one
point she said (paraphrasing),

  "...so if all these psychedleics -- ecstasy etc, break down
social/cultural barriers as you say, don't wild orgies break out?"

"Sure, occasionally," I said, "But only if it's a really good party..."

Might just see her at a rave soon.... ;)

She too was nice enough when all was said and done. Nice one PBS.

see ya

John S. Lee wrote:

> First off, I want to say I was disgusted at mr. Ruiz racist post.

I'm right there with you.  That's why I posted my response about
the fact that it wasn't funny, that it was racist, and that people
should think about what it is that they're laughing at and 
retelling.  I think some very anti-racist people on this list 
might be making the mistake of thinking that they're only laughing 
at a misunderstood policy, when in fact, after thinking it through,
they may suddenly realize that the jokes have a hurtful, racist 
aspect to them as well.  

As for "laughing at ourselves", that's only fine when the 
person the jokes center around finds them funny.  I get a little 
tired of the "redneck" jokes -- y'know, "family-trees-with-too-
few-branches" type jokes.  They're funny the first 14-or-so times 
you hear them, then they wear thin, and then even the semi-polite 
ones are downright offensive.  Being a Southern boy, I find that 
there is a pervasive attitude here against Southern people that 
depicts them as ignorant, shotgun-toting, pig-romancing, 
dentally-neglected, hygiene-challenged, idiots generated by a 
severely limited gene-pool.  I often see that reflected in how
I'm treated in business situations.  I'm respected right up until
I open my mouth.  I'm a senior systems engineer with over a 
decade of software experience under my belt, but I have to fight 
just to be included in some conversations, even when I'm the 
acknowledged expert.

Anyway, I did not find Mr. Ruiz's "joke" funny at all.  And as for 
those that might react negatively to your post, just blow them 
off.  You're dead on.  On the other hand, as for the "nice people"
side of this, I'd be willing that Noah just failed to think about
how it might be taken.  I'm sure he's a nice guy in need of a 
little education.  I *sincerely* hope he doesn't fall into the
same category with Jesse Helms and James Earl Ray!

(said in an "Erckel" voice) So get down with your bad self, 
my brother!  Cracking on the busted science, and, uh, 
righteous melanin, and, um...  stuff...

;)

S

Pengo@ten.net,Productions@ten.net,Internet writes:
>Hmmmm... that reminds me, has anyone ever tried out thoes 'Herbal E'
>thingies? Are they worth it at all?

I've tried various herbal E solutions and I found them all to work for
me.  They aren't as good as the real thing AND you really need to be
careful with them, improper dosing can really mess-you-up (even kill
you).  I know that improper dosing of anything can be potentially
fatal... it's just that the "experience" you get from the herbal
products is much, much mellower than the real thing and it's easy to be
tempted to take more, thus the hazard.  Also, be prepared to abstain
from eating ANYTHING for 12-18 hours before dosing! (Normally, I can
eat ANYTHING up to 6 hours before taking the real thing....)  The cost
of the product, by the time you take as many tablets as required, is
pretty much equiv to taking the full version.  The plus is the fact
that you don't get "altered" by it and can function fine the next day
if you are sensitive to the effects of mdma.

That's my all my knowledge on the subject,
pLur,
-SoNiC

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Mon Feb  3 12:31:35 1997
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.8.4/V2.0) id MAA08221; Mon, 3 Feb 1997 12:31:35 -0800 (PST)
Received: from uclink4.berkeley.edu by taz.hyperreal.com (8.8.4/V2.0) with ESMTP id MAA08208; Mon, 3 Feb 1997 12:31:26 -0800 (PST)
Received: from uclink.berkeley.edu (uclink.berkeley.edu [128.32.155.3]) by uclink4.berkeley.edu (8.8.4/8.6.12) with ESMTP id MAA07343 for <sfraves@hyperreal.com>; Mon, 3 Feb 1997 12:31:22 -0800 (PST)
Received: (from anthrax@localhost) by uclink.berkeley.edu (8.8.4/8.6.12) id MAA13835 for sfraves@hyperreal.com; Mon, 3 Feb 1997 12:25:09 -0800
From: Ann Elizabeth Loraine <anthrax@uclink.berkeley.edu>
Message-Id: <199702032025.MAA13835@uclink.berkeley.edu>
Subject: NRR: Ebonics Primer
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Date: Mon, 3 Feb 1997 12:25:04 -0800 (PST)
X-Mailer: ELM [version 2.4 PL23]
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

If you are a little kid, and you are first going to school, and the
teacher tells you not to talk "like that," what are you going to do?  How
can you talk any way but how you talk?  Wouldn't it be great if the
teachers could explain that how you talk is okay, but that you
should learn to speak in the standard way?

I grew up in Texas, and for some strange reason, my family spoke standard
English at home.  My little kid brain was quite delighted that nobody told
me at school not to talk "like that."  But there were plenty of other kids
who didn't speak the standard way, and they had a very hard time of it.  

I could tell even then that there was something interesting and different
about how Black and Latino kids expressed themselves, and they that were
getting some serious sh*t from the teachers over it.  The teachers made
them feel they were ignorant, but really they weren't.  It was the
teachers who were ignorant!

Black English has a long and fascinating history.  Why not teach it in
school- at least to teach people how to translate into standard
English?  And to teach people about all the slang and not-slang
expressions and structures in standard English that Black people invented.
And about the debt American culture owes to African-Americans.  In this
respect, acknowledging Ebonics seems a step in the right direction.

-Ann

to take E.

E around 10pm) -AFTERGLOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! she wants to go to another one

homey up, and showed him the way home), I remember the first Asian person 
I ever met as the center of a racially divided team (the white guys chose 
him, the black team chose me); he got bum rushed and got his face beat 
and glasses broken.  He and I sat out the rest of the game while a riot 
ensued.  He is still one of my closest frineds, one Mr. Grant Lam.

From: Lorin Gabriel Ashton <oblio@cats.ucsc.edu>
X-Sender: oblio@ese.UCSC.EDU
To: knowoneness-l@teleport.com
cc: Happy Ravers <sfraves@hyperreal.com>,
        everyone <knowoneness-l@teleport.com>, goa@party.net
Subject: Re: know-l (BSP) Feb 1 "koinonea" psychedelic trance ritual
In-Reply-To: <Pine.3.88.9701041807.A7510-0100000@svpal.svpal.org>
Message-ID: <Pine.SUN.3.91.970203134351.1242A-100000@ese.UCSC.EDU>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

hello,
I wanted to give an ocean of thanks to every soul that gave itself to 
helping out with Koinonea on Saturday. I was amazed at how openly people 
shared themselves and what they had to offer with one another. I think 
dancing creates a kind of unity that transcends the boundaries we as a 
people have. Also, sharing plays an equally important role in fostering 
community. I felt that as a whole, we managed to ascend from the 
constraints of third dimensional drama and pressure, and re-unite 
together, somewhere high in the sky, to hug and laugh.....

One thing that bothered me.....
There was a small group of guys in particular who, pardon me, did not 
belong and WERE NOT welcome. They were welocm when they first came in, 
and they were welcome to be free and share themselves for about an hour. 
But when they began tagging the walls, intimidating people, and being 
scary and unpleasant, they GAVE UP the privelege of being there. This is 
a tuff issue for me, because while I want ot embrace everyone who comes 
inside and I want everyone to be welcome, some people who infringe on 
other people prevent people at the party from feeling safe and welcome. 
At about 3:00, when I asked them peacfully, calmly and politely to leave 
because they were being unpleasant and unfairly infringing on others (and 
because they were drunk), they refused. I did not know what to do, since 
the last thing I would want to happen is a confrontation of violence or 
physical force, so they stayed. What I am doing now, may seem mean, but I 
feel it is necesary:
If you are going to come to a Koinonea gathering, please respect every 
person's right to be and to be free. If you are going to be intimidating, 
if you are going to infringe on others, if you are there to rudely "mack" 
on people as if they were meat, if you are going to disrespect ANYONE, 
		DO NOT COME, BECAUSE YOU ARE NOT WELCOME!!!!!!!!!

Otherwise, (and I'm sorry to even have to address this issue, and bring 
the unpleasantness of this issue up) all are welcome and let's  continue 
to gather peacefully as a group of individuals forming ONE whole. Thank 
you for understanding.


*reafirming the bond of connectedness*
Lorin

Well,  I already responded to John S. Lee privately.  It was supposed to
goto the list, but I'm glad it didn't.  This email is basically towards
those who piss me off and that would be mainly one person... but if you
feel you need to read this and you get offended by it, PLEASE SPARE THE
REST OF THE LIST, and email me privately.

I do wish that certain people would just leave this alone.  I apologize for
not thinking before posting, but you know what people, shit happens and
sometimes one makes mistakes.  If you all feel your better than that then
you should leave me out of your petty flames about a joke cause I'm really
not at your level and never will be.

Its slang no matter how you look at it.  If you want to put a race behind
it then do so.  Ebo, Indianbo whatever its the same we all talk slang
therefore we're all part of this thing called language and life...  DEAL
WITH IT, FOLKS!

All I know is that Double standards bite.  And I see alot of it especially
on this list from certain people...

I'm a minority (Apache Indian)  I don't need anyone telling me about
suffering.  My sisters and brothers got their land stolen.  Their wifes
rapped.  Their families killed.  And you don't see me using this to justify
my actions NOW, DO YOU!!!!

If you all can't handle a little slang then sorry don't read it.  Its all
around us.  So get used to it.

I don't see any of you backing up Native Americans.  As far as I'm
concerned your all racist and I'm fully disgusted with your actions towards
me...

Whine about how African "Americans" suffered then use it against everyone
later on... That makes fricken sense, John.  You guys crack me up...  Give
it up folks its done, its over.

I'm tired of hearing about how African "Americans" are all getting picked
on, and how they don't have any say in this world we live in.  John, if you
asked me its called DOUBLE STANDARDS, and I think you guys are milking it.


And don't give me this shit about me being racist for my words right now,
cause I talked to my Uncle "WHO IS BLACK", and he agrees with me.  So take
your shit and stuff it right back where you found it.  In your mouth.....

What about my say in this world, what about the land your on right now.
What about my family living on shitty land in Arizona cause people like you
have their head so far up their ass they can't smell their own shit any
more.

Don't irritate me with your babble about the past.  You all have your foot
in the door.  No one is stopping you...  You don't know nothing but lets
jump on the bad wagon and stand up for a race cause everyone else is doing
it and its cool...

I need to go and cool down now, and get my thoughts together.  You know,
live my life for today not the past.  I know its hard for some of you.  And
most of you will never get it.  And you know what, I don't care.  AS long
as my family and my friends are happy then I'm happy.

Have a fricken wonderful day...

Siphon!

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com

For those of you out there in SFR land who also suffer from a constantly
overflowing inbox, here's today's Procmail tip for getting through this
week's sludge and flamefests:

:0:
* ^Subject:.*Stevenson
* ^TOsfraves@hyperreal.com
/dev/null

Just add those four little lines to your .procmailrc, and you are good
to go! :) Have a nice day, everyone!

Oh yes, you can learn all about the wonders of procmail at:
http://www.cis.ohio-state.edu/hypertext/faq/usenet/mail/filtering-faq/faq.html

Happy plonking!

Steve

I am sick of all of this mindless blather.  "I am opressed".  "No, I am
more oppressed".  Is this some sort of claim to excellence?  Shut up, and
understand the fact that you are INDIVIDUALS first, members of this or that
race, ethnicity, or nation later.  As individuals, you have ultimate power
over your individual destiny, regardless of your oppression.  Personally, I
couldn't care less about what the color of someone's skin is.  It means
nothing in itself.  But a person who spouts sewage from their mouth, THAT I
care about.


>It sounds great to me.  If your nation could get the bux up to send me to
>anyplace they want to in the world, I might surely take them up on it.

Finally, a word on the United States.  While it is true that this country
has done some horrible things over the years, what country hasn't?  As
members of a social contract, we 'choose' to be Americans.  We have every
right in the world to leave.  Haiti?  Ghana? Syria? Yugoslavia? I doubt
that you would want to live in any of these countries.... or most countries
in the world, for that matter.  Any of us would be shot for saying the
things we say on this list.  When you complain about how bad it is here,
your provinciality shows.

Enough Said.

In the immortal words of Bob Marley, "SimmerDown"

PLUR, Kolin

okay kids.  This really is going to far.  I think everybody has to take a
minute to cool off.  I don't think anybody here is really meaning to lay on
the slander and racism.  Who is more racist the racist or the accuser?
This fight has been going on for way too long and I don't just mean on this
list.  We should all take some time to look at the generations who have
passed us by, for instance the baby boomers.  Who for the last 40 years
have preached to all of us about peace and loving one another and while the
backs were turned still maintained their hate as much as before.  Why don't
we, the new generation, try to make an effort to end the bullshit and just
be cool?  We don't need marches and sit-ins.  We don't need great leaders
and fierce warriors.  We just need to know, which I think that we all do,
that we are all here for the rest of our lives and our children's lives and
we have to live together.  Why don't we save out bickering and fighting and
hating for people who deserve it.  Like people who oppress and prevent
personal freedom and happiness.  The ebonics bit is something that we have
all heard too much about lately, and simply because it was in somewhat poor
taste or perhaps without forethought doesn't mean we should force someone
into angst.  I don't post to this list often, I just like to hear the
goings on, being that I'm not from SF (yet:) But from what I've seen you
all are way smarter than this shit.  You all give a damn about each other.
It's one thing to teach each other about what ebonics really is, this is
good.  I didn't know the truth about it, I appreciate the knowledge and
truth.  However, I don't even like to hear somebody else beat up like that.
 Everybody needs to relax and enjoy our differences.  We need to learn from
each other, my God I'm starting to sound like my mom.  Please make it go
away!!  
Seriously.  End it.  No more flames.  Just
Peace
-Eric

Hey all-

I was just reading a post about TT and him catching a buglar in his home and
them stabbing him. It is very interesting how people are quick to point out
nationality, cause had they been WHITE guys like they were no one mentions that
but if it is a person of color they are quick to say "some BLACK DUDES did it"
incedentally I was watching a program on TV and it was with some guys that were
in new york and they had robbed some guys and when the cops came they said who
did the robbing the guys said it was some "black dudes" and they were white
jewish guys on the program. This type of attitude gets me so upset cause I am a
african american and when some violent crime happens people always tend to
think that is a person of color. I am sick of people of color being used as
some scape goat for this society, It is real hard to in the "rave scene" cause
this scene is predominately european (I.E encompassing all "white people") I
hope that does not sound racist I dont mean to label it is just that if you say
"white" some people say im not white im this or that so I refer to people who
would be considered "white" european seeing how "white" people originated from
europe.
But NE-Wayz when there are "homies" at partys they are usally people or color
and it just makes me stop and wonder if my fellow rave brothers look at me in
that type of light? I would assume not seeing how I have experineced nothing
but love in this community. But I still feel that some of these persons are
like representing me even though I am not with them I feel that most people
discrimanate in groups. They don't say those guys over there they judge by one
persons actions. If some black guy is acting a fool at a party he does not
represent me or my race he represents his self, but society in most cases does
not see it that way. So to make a long story short, TT was appereantly beat up
by some europeans and yet "some black doodes" where blamed for it. And the same
thing with the lady that killed her children in Carolina once again "some black
guy" stole my kids and car. The real shame here is that no black people were
probably in these areas at the time :-(


ONE DAY WE WILL ALL BE COLOR BLIND...

Peace and love,

Macadio

It is now monday and our party went fairly ok due to all the tiny problems we
encountered during the course of the evening. Unfortunately donald glaude did
not show up due to he FUKING FAKED one us he called the day of the party from
ST. louis and his exact words were "dude im sorry im cathching a flight out
now" I will be in the bay area before your party. But we had already booked
terence toy from LA to take his place so we said ok you two can go on four
decks. That did not happen donald did not show up. :-(  Plus the person that
was supposed to supply the black light and various banners did not show as
well. However we did make due with what we had. I would like to thank all of
you who did come out I did have a good time and hope you all enjoyed my music.
Now with the girl at the end I have some not so good news. The young girl was
triping out on some acid and some FUCKING JERKS thought that it was ok to rape
her. I assume she was raped cause we found some used condoms and her friend who
stayed with us said that it might have happend. I would like to thank Dutch and
the mantra sound sound system for helping us out with the situation. One of the
guys from the mantra sound system said that he kind of remembers seeing the
guys but did not know what was going on? No one new until it was to late. But
we plan on using the Mantra sound again and we will keep our eyes out for this
FUCKING INHUMANE JERKS. And if we do catch them we will call the cops and due
some of our own things to them. I dont advocate violence but KNOW ONE has the
right to RAPE or hurt another human being under any circumstance. The one lady
turns out to be only 15 years old two that is really sad and we are real upset
about that. We plan on staying in contact with some of the girls who came to
the party that happened to take acid with the girl in question and try to work
through this problem. IT's people like that, that give our community a bad name
and scare promoters and partys, and the people that take controlled substances
need to be more responsibility two and informed about what they are taking and
be aware of your environment. But that still does not give any body the right
to put there hands on someone else, I feel deeply  hurt about the situation
because that is somebodys lil sister or daughter and I know if someone did that
to my sister mother or daughter I would be upset besides the simply fact that
is wrong. But enough about that it was a good party and the vibe was good. Look
out for our next party in April wich will be even better. We have learned a lot
from this experience and are ready to learn what we can and move on. BTW the
voice mail was messed up all day so we will be switching VM but I will post the
updated numbers. Plus if anyone is interested I will be playing some partys
this month um one next saturday and some others but nothing is set in stone.
Once again I would like to thank all that showed and Dutch and the mantra crew
