Your message was well spoken. 

I think people have misunderstood understood my terminology of "Ghetto
Children". This term was created to summarize a specific type of person.
A person who comes to a party souly to destroy the love we all share. To
hurt for  the soul purpose of self gratification. Some people may
understand what I mean if they have experienced what I am referring
about. 

I know one person that does know what I am talking about and this
person  brought to my attention some things that happened at Madness
that really disturbed her deeply. 

My term Ghetto Children is used for those people that only wish to
hurt others. It does not matter what neighborhood they are from East San
Jose, South San Francisco or the rich Cupertino or Los Gatos. I have
many friends from these not so happy places but they still live in the
sky with the care bears all happy as can be. But for those that inflict
hurt on others for no reason they to me are named the ghetto children. 



                          Enough Said
                                Kermit

I just have to say that I agree with this post entirely. Please think a
lillte bit before you post something to 400 people you dont know ... (of
course we all post bandwidth wastin stuff once in a while =) ... but you
gotta respect the fact that you dont know who or what the background of
most of these people are ... I am sure people here have grown up in a
"ghetto", not me... but its not a joke, its a cultural disease ... people
are born into situations(ie. born living in a "ghetto". the first 1/4 of
their lives is spent figuring out what that situation is with respect
to ever expanding communities (ie. my ghetto, your ghetto, hmmm ... you 
dont live in a ghetto, hmmm.... you dont live in my city ... state
church, school, nation, massivelover vs. UGlover ad nauseum)... if they
are lucky, they figure that part out(the part about how much does my
born-situation(for lack of a better word) affect my potential... I must
emphasise If they are LUCKY ... figuring this shit out is half the
battle... once you can see yourself as a part of a certain community and
structure that you were THROWN into, you can start moving into the
intentional restructuring of this situation 

... damn....that cartoon book
explanation of heideggers' philosophy sure is enlightening! 

learn to respect yourself...that is all you really need.
tony rose




On Mon, 24 Feb 1997, Fred Heutte wrote:

> I don't know who you are, "Candy Raver Kermit," but I know one thing for
> sure: you don't know who *we* are.  
> 
> sfraves has never been the kind of place where people indulge in careless
> talk about "getto children" and "bitches".  I think your appearance on this
> list is a sign of how the times have changed.  This kind of rough language
> is used by people to impress others with how tough they are, how superior
> they are.  We are *not* impressed.  And though there may be some interest
> in flaming right back, I suspect we're also going to get past that as well.
> 
> This kind of talk indicates either deep-seated racism (which is doubtful
> among the people likely to be interested in this list and this scene)
> or very shallow life experience.  Who are these "getto children" and where
> do they come from?  I wonder if you've even given this two seconds of 
> though, "Candy Raver Kermit."  If you ask *them*, I bet you'll find out
> they come from anywhere between and including West Oakland and Blackhawk,
> or any other two random points on this planet.  
> 
> If you judge any group based on their clothes, their way of talking or
> their skin color, it's certainly a way to stir up discussion and yelling.
> But this is what James Brown meant when he sang about "talking loud and
> saying nothing."  
> 
> As our little underground dance music scene started spreading out into wider
> society, we started seeing some of the superficial and negative attitudes
> circulating in general society start creeping in as well.  
> 
> If we really believe in the ideals we expressed in the past under the banner
> of the House Nation, we had better be prepared to deal with this whole ball
> of wax.  
> 
> The party Saturday night was not a "getto children party," it was a Cool
> World party.  The vibe at their parties is the vibe *they* develop.  It
> has to do with motivation and perspective.  Enough said.
> 
> As for the "ghetto," let's do a little thought experiment.  Imagine that
> the places people consider to be "ghettos" had never existed.  Those are
> places where people, regular people just like us, grow up, live, have
> families, work, play, smile, cry, conduct real lives under difficult
> circumstances.  It's not just about people roughing each other up and worse
> on the street.  That's a fact of that life, but not the only one.  
> 
> One other thing -- there music in the "ghetto" -- a LOT of it, it comes
> straight from the heart under the most difficult circumstances.
> 
> Without the "ghetto" we would have:
> 
> - No jazz, born in New Orleans, Chicago, Kansas City, Harlem New York and LA.
> 
> - No rock'n'roll, born on the doo-wop streetcorners of Manhattan, Brooklyn
>   and the Bronx.
> 
> - No disco, born in the gay underground clubs from New York to San Francisco.
> 
> - No hip hop, straight from the streets of Crooklyn.
> 
> - No house, from the heart of Chicago and New York.
> 
> - No techno, from the soul of Detroit.
> 
> - No jungle, from the polyglot sprawl of London.
> 
> - No reggae, from the hardest ghetto of all, Trench Town Kingston.
> 
> This is an important issue -- how we talk to each other and the terms we
> use.  I don't think anyone here really condones this kind of abuse of the
> language and sloppy thinking.  The question is, how do we deal with it?
> Online "communities" are fragile and easily sidetracked and even destroyed
> by carelessness, cluelessness and malice.
> 
> I apologize for going on and on like this, but I feel that the issue of
> what our obligations are to deal with these superficial and messed-up
> attitudes in the "kids" entering into this scene is a very important one.
> 
> We all have our residual prejudices.  The only shame is in not dealing with
> them and using what we learn to help others.  It is not a nice process,
> a happy process.  It is a necessary process.  There is much wisdom in the
> statement: 
>   
>   Positive education always corrects error.
> 
> peace out
> phred
>

ghet-to: /n./   1.  In certain European cities, a section to which Jews were
formerly restricted.    2. Any section of a city to which many members of
some minority group live, or to which they are restricted as by economic
pressure or social discimination.

>The point I am trying to make is, " Ghetto  Children " are the people
>that kill the happy vibe. Keep it from flowing. Usually by looks,
>attitude, and their immature desires to fight. 

In about a bajillion other posts on this list I've seen the term
"gangstas" used to refer to vibe-killing, attitude-copping, potentially-
violent party poopers.  Why not stick with that?  "gangsta" to me means
someone who chooses to gang and bang, whereas "ghetto children" seems like
a slam against kidz who happened to grow up in da inner city.

In other words, Kermit, you're pissing people off with "ghetto children"
because there's nothing wrong with being from the ghetto, and not all kids
from the ghetto cop the anti-vibe you're talking about.

Oh well, flame on....

PEOPLE!!!!!

this is a rave mailing list and we people are not perfect, so we all make
mistakes! 

This list should have freedom of speech, yet if someone says something that
is offending, PLEASE, DO NOT bash that person for it. Post a reply to, or
better yet, privately e-mail that person and tell them what you thought was
offensive and why. The person whose head you are bashing in might have
thought that "thunder-thighs" were extremely spicy chicken legs, not a
derogatory remark slandering those who are overweight. And when they said
that the 'crackers in this restaurant were stale' they probably werent
saying in a mean way that there were elderly caucasions there.

I know these two examples are rather cheesy, but I am just using them to
make a point.

I'm sorry, as long as I'm on this track, there is a couple other things i
have wanted to say, but haven't been in a 'voice-my-opinion' mood til now. 

It seems to me that some ppl that subscribe to this list edit the mail they
recieve rather than digest it. Sometimes I will read a post that had a lot
of feeling put into it, and then read a reply that, rather than containing
feedback, contains one line stating "The word is spelt 'temple' not
'tempel'." A reply like this really discounts the the emotion was put into
the initial post. I want my voice to be heard, not graded for errors.

Another thing, and I have been guilty of this before(who hasnt?) brings
a couple of words to mind, "impulse, assume," and maybe even 
"impatience". Take this for example;

- You finally finish downloading the 158 e-mails you recieved from SFRAVES
mailing list during your lunch hour, and begin to skim for topics that seem
interesting, you see a subject that draws your attention, so you open it.
You read the first two lines hurriedly, and think to yourself, 'FUCK THIS!
I gotta send a reply to this!' So you angrily write your reply dissaproving
of the statement that had been posted. Then three seconds later think,
'hmmm, maybe i should read the rest of that post." Don't we feel dumb now?

Sorry to bring up negatives of sfraves, but to me, these things can put a
damper on and/or bury posts that really deserve attention. There is so much
energy in this mailing list, i feel it every time i hit the 'check mail'
button.

-EVEN MORE LOVE!!!

-justin




.

Hmm...
This seems a little out of line and a little out of character from what
I've experienced with Rampant.  When I had my radio show at KDVS, Rampant
used to send CDs from time to time (Planet Rampant, etc.) and I have
picked up many Rampant vinyls over time.  I have not had any problems with
the pressings I've picked up.  It's possible that your buddy just got a
bad rekkid... maybe the person at the shop left it in the sun or
something.  :/
Seeing as Rampant puts out some really fun left-coast breakbeats, I think
it would be a little harsh to just ignore the label from now on, but also
there are plenty of other labels and artists out there, so it's not like
you'll be missing out on techno all together.  
I'll keep buying Rampant rekkids, if I like 'em.  I'd like to hear the
track that your buddy had a problem with, tho...

I know I know I know I'm not supposed to let this get to me but I can't help
it!  Ack!  My god, what on earth is this person talking about?  Was there
some enormous knife threat at Madness (no doubt caused by some evil Concord
circle-dancers! ;) that we happy rose-colored-glasses-wearing ravers just
missed cuz we're blind?  I sure as HELL dont think so!  And I'm sure that
Joe as one of the promoters would be the one to know.  I know that smiling
dancing ravers offering you water can frequently be mistaken for evil knife-
& gun-wielding criminals who are out to sell you crappy drugs, but COME ON!
And Madness *commercial*???  "Puh-leaze.  Oh. My. God.  Like I am SO sure."
Yeah, and monkeys might fly out of my butt.  (whoops, mental image I did
*not* want). And the unmitigated gall of the Madness folk to charge *$5*!
Obviously they're just out to make a buck.  Shit, they can have my buck!

Really, some facts about where you get your opinions of Madness being
overly-commercial and full of violence would be warranted.

Madness reminded me once again about why I fell in love with raving in the
first place, and *most* everybody here knows it.

Again:
*sigh*

And I apologize to everybody else for letting him get to me. :(

Much love,
Shawna

On Mon, 24 Feb 1997, SDream wrote:

> Brian Denny wrote:
> 
> > can we please stop making generalizations about prices of parties?
> > 
> > i've been to some GREAT $20 parties, and some @#$%^& ones.
> > i've been to some AMAZING $5 parties too. and some not-so-good ones.
> > ...
> > point #2: "it was a 6 dollar party" is not an excuse for anything.
> 
> Brian is absolutely right about these points.
> 
> > point #1: you can't judge a party by its cover.
> 
> But I can't agree with this one.  If you read the whole cover, and
> follow "Krusty's Rules" for parties, you *can* judge how a party will
> *probably* go off.  To paraphrase my meager memory of the "Krusty's
> Rules":
> 
> 1. The larger and fancier the flyer, the worse it's going to be.  Small,
> simple flyers are the best.
> 
> 2. The more phone numbers, the worse it's going to be.  If it has more
> than two numbers, there's a problem.
> 
> 3. The more overpublicized a party is, the worse it's going to be.  When
> I saw a party getting huge advertising in any form, I avoided it. 
> There's going to be too many immature people looking for a public forum
> in which to get baked and look mean.
> 
> 4. And the most important rule: go with promoters with good reps.  My
> faves were FnF, Gateway, and Harmony.  I've been to good parties by
> other promoters, Nomad and FGE included, but NOTHING beat those three
> promoters for consistently phat, vibey parties.
> 
> 5. Actually, point 4 ties with point 5 for importance: go where other
> ravers you know and love are going.  We all have been at some really
> crappy party where the sound was awful, the lighting was nonexistant,
> and there were just too many darn bodies packed in one place, but we
> found some friends to party with and it turned out to be a killer night
> after all.  The *people* make the party.
> 
> S
>

Ghetto Child (noun)
1. Child from ghetto
2. The oposite of E Child
3. People that enjoy UNCOOL WORLD parties
4. A child that lives ina house that is ghetto
5. A Bad Vibe Gangster

Comments:
A Ghetto is a place where people of ANY ethnicity, religion, race,
color, sex, label can live. There is nothign bad about living in a
ghetto. There is nothing un-plurish with the truth.

Love.Luck.Lollipops

I would just like to say to anyone who flames anyone for any comment:
Let he who has never sinned cast the first stone!!

Remebr that before you flame me with a remark about religion for this
one.
By the way I am not Chirstian or Chatholic I am Jewish.
So why am I posting something that Jesus said? It makes since thats why.
Everyone needs to get off the stupid flaming shit. Its poitnless.
Everyone on all of SFRaves has probably said something to someone about
ghetto chidlren or adidas freaks or massive-rats or preppy bitches that
talk all night on your phone.
Everyone!!! Wake up and smell the ceptic tank! Boys are not made of
snips and snail and puppy dogs tails. Girls are not made of sugar and
spice and everything nice.

Welcome to Reality 101! Its a cruel world. How do I know??
Whats the first thing that happenes at the begining or birth.

You are all comfy in a nice bubble of warm fluids. Some fat lady that
looks liek a circus tent that wants you to call her moms does all teh
eating/breathing/pissing/shitting/crack for you for nine months.
Then all of a sudden your little bubble of warmth is popped all the
fluids drain out. Then the hole starts to squeeze you out. May take a
day and a half or a few mintues. Then right before you think its gonna
squeeze you to a pulp your out.
Bright lights are in your eyes. Theres a fat ugly doctor with bad breath
looking at you. He shoves something down your throat nose ears etc.
He cuts your cord and hangs your upside down and smacks your chubby
little ass. You scream in pain.
They wash you off in cold water wrap you in a blanket and had you over
to this half disenflated bitch that wont stop buggin you with "Awww
isn't he cute."; He has his fathers eyes!"; and "What a good strong
boy."

Everything is peaches and cream for a while and then you start
kindergarten. Then comes Jr.High where everyone excludes you fromt ehir
clique and then comes puberty. Acne. AIDS. Teen Pregnancies. Fights.
Gangs. Parents. Peer Presure. School Work. Money. Jobs. and a whole
bunch more of uncomfortable shit.

This goes on until you kick the bucket and die!

And now they tell us we need to be little happy ravers.
Well Okay with me I can do that. But If i say some comment like ghetto
children or adidas or plur don't piss on me just because what i say or
the terminolgy is un-acceptable to your eyes!!!

SFRaves is
1. A paging sevice
	-How the fuck eles are we suppose to get in contact with a raver 
	who's phone numebr we don't have?
2. A place to gripe
	- How the hell else are the promoter gonna know if we like or 	don't
like their little rave.
3. A place to shit on COOL WORLD
	- Come on people we all know COOL WORLD doesn't throw raves. 		Its a
party productions. They don't need the be plurish
	besides if it wasn't for COOL WORLD what raves would all the bad 	vibes
go to?
4. Not a place to flame other peopel and take out all the stress from
being a raver in a scene thats is deteriorating faster than we can say
Peace. Love. Unity. & Respect
5. FUN for the family.

If you read all this thanks.
And I leave you with this note.
Shit on me and fuck you all.
By the way if you see me at a rave you know that i am cool and full of
good vibes even of the e.
Thsi is life people learn to deal with the ghetto children of society.
Okay I think I am done posting for at least a month now.
Please flame me openly so everyone can see how nicely you all prove my
point.
Oh and to all my FRIENDS on SFRaves: I love you all and don't take this
personally because deep inside you all agree and are tired of all the
bull shit on this mailing list.

Love.Luck.Lollipops,
Paul

I hate to get into this whole mess but it seems that you and Kermit 
are throwing this whole thing into SFRaves about how "ghetto 
children" ruin the vibes at parties, yet then you post that CoolWorld 
parties aren't raves.. If you don't want to be around these type of 
people, then here's an idea, don't go.. or go, make the best of it, smile..
and don't complain.. we have 
plenty of good parties out there.
	 try to put it into a "ghetto kid's" 
POV (point of view).. they go to clubs, hear a few club djs are 
spinning at a HUGE thing in an abandoned wearhouse in Oakland, and 
there will be easy access to drugs, girls/boys and other people's 
shit to gank or something. or, maybe some ofthem DO go for the music. 
	they show up, and find a bunch of what they think are freaks 
dressed in kiddy clothes, running around hugging and kissing 
people they don't even KNOW, smearing stinky gooey glitter and vicks 
vaporub all over the place..their eyes wild with the 
vibe/drug/music/whatever they're excited about. I know that a friend 
met a girl at a partyy who said she HATED the party because she 
thought people were too nice there. It's all about the perspective. 
You'd have to be a damn fool to go into a Cool World party expecting 
it to have a great vibe.. There are 2 totally different types of 
people coming together to do 1 thing -- party and have a good time -- 
and our definitions of "partying" are incredibly different.
I guess this is where my point kicks in ;))
 There is no one perfect group to belong to. 
you're not COOL just because you smile and give a sticker to someone 
one night then bash people the next day by callingfriends you invited 
into your home "bitches" or whatever. you're not COOL because you 
know all the phattest tunes and you wear the funkiest shit. those 
things don't make you cool. what makes you cool is what comes from 
your heart. if it's love, warmth, caring and happiness, you're down. 

	i know the intentions of Kermit and Paul and all are not to 
hurt anyone, they are in fact expressing their opinions. Perhaps we 
all got a little out of hand bashing them, but then, perhaps they got 
a little out of hand themselves. Now let's all just take a deep 
breath, forget the term "ghetto children" even came to mind, and let 
each other have opinions in peace. Express your opinion, hell yes!
It's our right to express whatever we damn well please.. but do it 
without the razor-edge next time, your words and spirit will be much 
more respected in the longrun, even *if* flaming boosts your ego a 
lil bit :)
love, hugs and PEACE to you all (for once guys?! :))
lara

Hey everyone,

Well our first collective party went great.  Dispite the fact we had to 
change locations at 2 am we all had a lot of fun.   I know this is not 
really san francisco rave teritory but there is no central coast list and 
well I'm from the bay area.  

   We found a great space but unfortuantly the owner as well as the  san 
Luis Obisbo police department would not allow us to continue the party 
past 2.  We had a back up location and because we know of this in 
advanced we planned a free outdoor sunset on Sunday the next day.  Wow 
what work this whole event was but now that I look on it, it was all good.
We got about 300+ people and lost only about 100 buck for the whole 
weedend but it was well worth it.  

	We decorated the place with daygolw paintings, blacklights and 
Jesica T worked out a nice lighting display for us.  (btw she will be 
moving to sf soon to provide you sfr's some w/ nice eye candy and some 
fresh ideas :)  We charged $7 (even though we had nice flyers.  We got a 
deal from monochrome (LA) but after the hastle to get them up it wasn't 
worth it - a whole notha story)    

Good things:  No drugs and a GREAT vibe! All the dj's were great.  Thanks 
MODA and Jazz-e for comming and staying to play at the beach party.  
Stareyes layed down some sick jungle and Spaceboy did great for his first 
jungle set.  Morgan rocked but we had to cut him off at 2 but he 
continued at the new space with Mika playing some trip hop, Diego-v 
played some house and Maris went on as well.

 Sunday was beauty full.  30-40 close friends on the beach dancing and 
enjoying the tunes of Jazz-e, MODA, Spark-e, Alex and spaceboy.  We 
started around 3 and continued till about 10.30 pm when the mostly full 
moon luminated the sky line.   We built a huge bon fire and succeded in 
gettting everyone to their feet to join hands and dance around the flames 
together for at least 20 minutes.  (Dennis - Eric I wish you could have 
seen it. )

Thanks Dennis for your kind review and again Moda for comming out,  I'll 
calll ya.  

This friday Morgan's planning another SLO party but however we have the 
same restrictions as with MASS that we have to close at 2am.  (Damn the laws)
So they have a back up location to move the party to. 
   Mike and I just 
found a warehouse out side of town.  The owner will allow us to go all 
night and she even likes the dance movement,  and would mind us doing a 
monthly party there.  If it works out we will have another "old school" 
party planed in March or April.  

This Friday is Axcess with Morgan, Greg (harmony) {can't wait to met ya 
again and hear you spin},  Rico, Astronut Skot, Alex and um another I 
think.  I don't know the voice mail off hand but It will be a 5 dollar 
party.  

                          Support the underground. 

 (btw what happend in SF with Willie Brown, 
Raves, Restrictions, his daughter (did she go to the hospital or 
something).   I heard some rumors, whats the real story?)

PLUR<

       Austin

        ------------------(   (  ( ((0)) )  )   )-----------------

well, i've already gotten one SPAMMER kicked off his ISP by using the
techniques below (making sure the postmasters associated with the spam
account know that their users are sending out unsolicited e-mail). I've
also been updating my mailfilter to auto-file/delete the offending
message each time i receive a spam (generalizing things when I notice a
pattern or an ISP/organization that caters to spammers (e.g. sallynet.com).)

I suggest you all start doing the same because it is our silence that
is allowing these creeps to proliferate!

Anyways, here are my mailfilter rules I use to zap the spammers:

##
## Delete Advertizing Spams
##
Comments "Authenticated sender is" ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Apparently-To rizzi@netcom.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Apparently-To mturner@netcom.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Apparently-To mbartlow@netcom.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Apparently-To mazzarel@netcom.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Apparently-To mazumdar@netcom.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Apparently-To mayhem@netcom.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Apparently-To maz@netcom.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
>From vip@allvip.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
>From tt@way.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
>From ici@ici.net ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
## generalized from Internet.Promoter@alberta.sallynet.com, and
## sesame@alberta.sallynet.com
To alberta.sallynet.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
Message-Id sallynet.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
>From The.SECRET@wavenet.com ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"
## "Unsolicited Commercial E-mail" flag from bizops@isp-inter.net
Subject (UCE) ^ ? "/usr/local/lib/mh6.7/rcvstore +spam"

and here are tonights attempts at fighting the good fight against spammers:

------- Forwarded Messages

To: mabel@sallynet.com, gladys@nancynet.com, info@sohocenter.com,
    dogman@sohocenter.com, ceo@nancynet.com, postmaster@sohocenter.com,
    postmaster@nancynet.com, postmaster@sallynet.com
Cc: abuse@netcom.com, postmaster@netcom.com
Subject: please remove me from you e-mail SPAM lists!
Date: Tue, 25 Feb 97 00:57:22 -0800
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom12>


I've just added the "e-mail signature" of a most recent SPAM you've
sent to my mailfilter, so I will not receive any more SPAMs sent from
your organizations to my mail-address. I have effectively been doing
this in the past, allowing me to ignore unsolicited e-mails sent from
your organization(s) against my will, and despire repeated protests and
unsubscribe requests. Of course, your addresses and front-organizations
keep on changing, so I really am getting tired of updating my
mailfilter to auto-delete the crap you assholes are sending me.

Just to make things clear, THIS IS A PRIVATE E-MAIL ADDRESS USED FOR
BUSINESS PURPOSES ONLY AND YOUR MAILINGS ARE INTEREFERING WITH MY
BUSINESS PRACTICE. I REQUEST THAT YOU CEASE AND DESIST SENDING
UNSOLICITED E-MAIL TO MY E-MAIL ADDRESS. This is not the first time I
have requested that you cease annoying me. If this HARASSMENT doesn't
stop, will begin taking further measures, which could be legal, or as a
last resport, I will stoop to your own cretinous level (how'd you like
it if people  started spamming you all back? Maybe you'd one day find
your e-mail addreses added to a reflector to some high-volume USENET
newsgroup containing discussions on topics which you have no interest
in??). Would such actions be any different from your repeated attempts
at sending unsolicited mail against the will of the majority of e-mail
users out there?

However, I'd rather keep things on the up-and-up, so howabout if you
stop using my address for unsolicited e-mail? Please remove it from all
your lamo internet marketing lists because I will go out of my way to
disparage and ignore any products being sold using such sleaze-tactics.

Thank you, and good night!
	Niels.

against these organizations that seem to be spamming many netcom
accounts.

Dear Friend:

Before  you listen to what we are going to announce, please read  the following 
' Editorial Excerpts '  from some important publications in the United States :

New York Times:
'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''  " In concluding our review of financial organizations to effect 
change in the 90's, special attention should be called to the  'World Currency
Cartel' based in California. Members of this organization are amassing hundreds 
of millions of dollars in the currency market using a LEGAL METHOD which has 
not been  divulged to the  general  public.  While their purpose if any is not yet 
known, their presence has most certainly been felt" .

ABC Nightly News:
''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''      "Members of the World Currency Cartel are among the 
                               wealthiest, most powerful men/women in this hemisphere".

More Excerpts  later;  But first let us tell you this:
'''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''                                                        
For a short time, the World Currency Cartel will instruct a limited  number of  
people worldwide how to CONVERT $25  INTO ONE HUNDRED OF LEGAL
CURRENCY. We will transact the first conversion for you, after that you can
quickly and easily do this on your own hundreds or even thousands of times 
every month. TAKE ADVANGE OF THIS 'SECRET FLAW' !
                      '''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
We are sure you can see the power of this, however it is even more explosive
than we have yet disclosed. While currency does fluctuate daily, we can show
you how to CONVERT $99 INTO $580 as many time as you want and every 
single day. That means you will be able to exchange $99 AMERICAN LEGAL
CURRENCY DOLLARS (the green paper you buy your groceries with) FOR
$580 OF THE SAME, AND YOU CAN DO THIS AS MANY TIMES AS YOU
WANT EVERY DAY....... VERY LEGALLY & EFFORTLESSLY !!!
                                        '''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
It only takes about 10 to 15 minutes each time you do this. You can do this
from your home, office or while travelling. All you need is an access to  any
phone line and you can do this from any city on this earth.

Again, we must reiterate: 
''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''     Anyone can do this and the source is never-ending.
As long as the Global Financial Community continues to use different currencies
with varying exchange rates, the SECRET FLAW will exist.
                                              '''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''  
We at the World Currency Cartel would like to see a Uniform Global Currency
backed by gold, but until then we will allow a LIMITED number of individuals
to share in the UNLIMITED PROFITS provided for by the world paper currency
differentials.

We will espouse no more political views nor will we ask you do so. We can say,
however, that our parent organization  'Diamond International' benefits greatly by
the knowledge being shared as we ourselves along with you benefit likewise. 
Your main concern, however, will be how you benefit.

In a short time with almost NO investment or training, you will be a Currency Ex-

When I lived in the dorms at UCD in 1992-1993, our dorm was reall trashed
really quick.  There were roaches everywhere, there were holes in the
walls, etc.  Our building was the music, arts and crafts specialty program
and we were all really close and we all had a lot of fun no matter what.
Anyway, our building, Sereno, was lovingly called "Ghettodorm".  Don't
believe me?  Ask Joe!  Back me up here, toughguy!
:)
Long live the ghetto!!

PS:  I picked up a record by 'Ghettoelectro' on Bottom Heavy unlistened
just because the artist had 'Ghetto' in their name... turns out it's a
really cool rekkid!

to live in a ghetto to exhibit the tendencies of destroying the love we all

ein the ghetto who work, take care of thier kids and protect them from the
evil that MAY exist in their realm?

You see, that is what happens when you use a word, and either don;t think
before using it, or you don;t consider WHERE you're pulling the term from.

making up new terms.

At 8:17 PM -0800 2/24/97, =A4[Oo]=A4 wrote:
<cut>
>>Um, Kermey, I believe you're being called a racist for that comment, and
>>I would tend to agree.  Again, could you explain, in clear terms, what
>>you mean by "ghetto children"?
>
>
>
>I don't see what is racist about this term?
>ghetto is a term applied to a bad neighborhood as far as i know,

And, er, who lives in these, er, bad neighborhoods?  Ghetto is a eurpean
word.  I beleive it has semitic origins.  Neils, help me out on this one
please.

And does a bad neighborhood mean all the poeple in it are bad?

Ok, here's my beef:  Why is it that peoples parents have done sucha
godawful job of expanding thier childrens horizons beyond thier gated
communities?  I remember being brought up (a long time ago, before fucking
MTV ok?) and there was this poor section of our neighborhood.  It was where
all the, er bad blacks lived.  People int he neighborhood called them boos.
Hell, I was a kid, my parent didn't raise me to be a Panther so I started
calling them that as well.  Hey after all, they dressed worse than I,
weren't the cleanest, and often wore shoes that were worn or didn't match.
They were poor people.  When my dad heard me call these folks that at the
table, he glared at me and said, in a most stern fashion "Just because they
live there doesn't mean they are any less than you.  They are people not
boos.  And oh yeah boy, do you know what that word means?" I replied "Yeah
of course dad, it's a term for those people becuase they live in that part
of the neighborhood!"  So rigtheous I.  My dad looked at me again and said
"Those people look just like you, and I would bet that they would do better
if they had the fortunes you were lucky enough to be born in.  Also son, I
can see that you need to know a word before you use it.  Boo is another
term for jigaboo son, it means nigger.  Now how do you feel?"  So righteous
no more.  I lowered my head, and my father looked at me "Never use that
word again in my presence or under any other circumstance."

You see, we often know little of what we speak, and yet have such glorious
explanation for our verbal foibles.

So I ask again, what does ghetto mean to you?

>
>i think you are the one being racist saying that only certain ethnicities
>are in the ghetto.

Nobody said that.  The only thing anyone said was that ghetto means ethnic
neighborhood.  Your OWN racist tendencies filles in the proverbial blank
with a face of your choosing.

In THIS country however, we use ghetto to signify inner cities, usually
poor, filled with people of color (oh yeah, when I use this term I mean
anyone who is not melanin challenged ;) ).  Now there are plenty of areas
where there are concentrations of poor whites.  People do not say they live
in ghettos, but I've heard whites call people white trash, or trailer
trash, and I beleive that is another form of bigotry.  But ghetto, due to
the amrican experience, brings to mind brown, yellow, and black faces.

So, what do you mean when you say ghetto or say that it's use is appropriate=
?

>Ghetto is not a term specifying any race or ethnic
>background what-so-ever, unless you are prone to belief in stereotypes.

What stereotype?  That race exists?  That people who live in inner city
'real' ghettos are people of color?  What stereotype are you talking about?
I dunno, the only stereotypes that I've been confronted with contnually are
those spouted on this list.  Almost as bad as TV at this point.


>
>-much love
>-justin
>
>

Hey Justin, can you can that long sig?

And which version of ghetto is the one you all prefer, the european or the
american translation?

I can't beleive we're even talking about this.  It's so obvious as to defy
all logic.

I give up.  When does the next shuttle leave?

John

In a message dated 2/24/97 8:03:53 PM, you wrote:

<< I think people have misunderstood understood my terminology of "Ghetto
Children". This term was created to summarize a specific type of person.
A person who comes to a party souly to destroy the love we all share. To
hurt for  the soul purpose of self gratification. Some people may
understand what I mean if they have experienced what I am referring
about.<<

This logic is, at best, extremely flawed and I would go so far as to say that
you are now re-defining your original definition of who you believe "Getto
Children" are. If this is your real idea of who and what constitutes a
"Getto" child, tell me how the word getto plays a role in the definition
itself. My interpretation of how you define "getto" is that you are using
that word as code for racist/ethnocentrist sentiment. Not to mention your use
of the word "Bitch" in reference to the two WOMEN who were on the phone at
the house party you attended(But it's my understanding that you'll be
schooled on that a little later too, so hang tight!).  

Phred went to great lenghts to educate us all with his earlier post so I wont
further elaborate on that subject specifically. But I would like to take this
time to address something that I feel is vital to discuss.

I am continually amazed at how people on this list refuse to believe that
issues of race/class/gender have no place on SFR, yet virtually every week,
we're dragged into this debate in some form or another. I strongly believe
that we as     
a House Nation will never truly progress as a movement until we can recognize
and overcome these basic obstacles. If not, how are we any different than
those who are on the outside, looking in, who we wish to change?  While we
preach peace, love, unity, etc., we do absolutely nothing to facilitate the
realization of these things here on this list and more importantly, in and
around the dancefloor and in our everyday lives.  And I know it's possible
too. It can be done.  Ask anyone who went to Freedom '93,  when for a few
moments, it seemed as though the whole history/future of the SF Dance scene
could have 
been destroyed within minutes, but with the love, dedication and  sense of
responsibility of the people in attendance, they turned a potentially
catastrophic event into one of the greatest triumphs I have ever personally
witnessed. Inspring moments like that are why I do what I do today.  But what
about the present? What are we doing to bring about real and positive change
so that the Kermit's of the world come to understand the concepts of basic
human understanding, concepts that are fundamental to the Dance Music
Community on the west coast? I think we have to go beyond stuff like eternal
flame wars like the one we're involved in now to find the answers.  

My last concern is list-related.  I havent been here that long, but I can't
help but think that a lot of that discussion here is totally out of line and
I beleieve something should be done about it.  I'm not saying these people
should be censored, I dont really know what I'm saying here.  People who are
admistrators on this list, Brian, etc., would it make sense to issue warnings
to people in situations like this?  Am I totally out of line here? someone
with some real experience here should respond to this.  

Respect, 
Monty

"[Oo]" wrote:

> >Um, Kermey, I believe you're being called a racist for that comment, and
> >I would tend to agree.  Again, could you explain, in clear terms, what
> >you mean by "ghetto children"?
> 
> I don't see what is racist about this term?

But obviously several people on this list did, and they took offense at
it.  References to ghettos tacitly refer to a predominance of certain
ethnicities, and connecting those ethnicities with negative behaviour is
certainly going to offend some folk's racial sensitivities.  None of it
refers to me, being melanin-challenged myself, but it offends me just
the same on behalf of those that it would refer to.  I'm not surprised
that it caused something of an outcry, and my response was intended to
be a calm request for clarification, not an indictment.  Since Kermit
has responded since then, this issue would seem to be closed, although
now the question becomes one of finding a better term to describe a
negative and even violent influence at an otherwise peaceful event. 
This topic has come up before, and a search of the archives will reveal
discussion and suggestions on alternative terminology.

Literately yours with phat hugz,

S

> And, er, who lives in these, er, bad neighborhoods?  Ghetto is a eurpean
> word.  I beleive it has semitic origins.  Neils, help me out on this one
> please.

I think you are being entirely too nice. Someone already explained the
european origins of Ghetto, which is a place where Jews were forced to
live by all those big-hearted, love-spouting, hypocritical 
do-unto-others-as-you-would-do-unto yourself Christians, and later used
by the Nazis as a convenient place to herd Jews together in poverty and
misery (after confiscating their property) for a few years before they
started deporting them to the concentration camps. Of course, Nazi's 
wouldn't have been able to perform their genocide without hundreds of
years of history and discrimination that allowed the person on the
street to start thinking of Jews as "the other" and dehumanized them to
the point where violence and repression and genocide could be justified
against them, and even codified into law and "the will of the people."

In the USA, we have a conventiently extensive culture of racism
(slavery of blacks, exploitation of Irish, Italians, Japanese, Chinese,
Native Americans) that can be plundred to allow "good hardworking
americans" to practice similar banality of evil w/o any kind of
remorse. And it clearly pervades our thinking and language when crap
like "ghetto children"  rolls off the tongues of our children so
easily, so unthinkingly.

Anyways, webster defines it as the following (i think a def. of this
was already posted in a different thread):
ghet-to n., pl. -tos  or -toes. 1. A slum section of a city occupied by a 
  minority group who live there because of social or economic pressure. 2. 
  A section or quarter in a European city to which Jews are or were 
  restricted. 3. Something that resembles the isolation or restriction of a 
  ghetto.-modifier: ghetto children.[Ital]

Basically, these (Kermit and Paul) idiots pissed me off enough that
I've added them to my mail-filter because I will feel the need to flame
them otherwise, and I have better things to do with my time, and the
readers of SFR could probably do without the negativity these creeps
are inspiring in me. So I will never see mail from anybody with PLUR in
their e-mail address, or his lamo tadpole friend. Happy, hungry,
healthy mailfilter. I gave Paul a fair chance given his hateful
rantings about homies and hoes a few months ago -- he clearly doesn't
get it and I don't need to waste valuable diskspace on his blather.

PS: it's amazing that after everybody's complaints about "gangstas"
these people needed to come up with an even more insulting description
"ghetto children" (c.f. webster's definition)... i understand where
they are coming from (w/r/t a thuggy rave w/ a bunch of people, white,
black, asian, latino, etc all acting "tough"). Thugs and disrespectful,
threatening, pushy, violent people has nothing to do with race, or even
economics, or living in the ghetto. Some perfectly evil, violent
assholes are born and raised upper middle class, or even rich. Many of
them are white and come from "good families." Their economics has less
to do with their being than the culture and the parents which created
these monsters.

This has more to do with the fact that our society is passing on it's
esteemed values of capitalism, greed, selfishness, combativeness,
materialism, contentiousness, lies, us-vs-them onto it's children. The
children have no choice and no other examples by which to live as the
partents, media, government has implicitly told them that -- pointless
turf fighting is good (vietnam, gulf war, cuba, panama), stealing from
the helpless is good (Keating, S&L loan crisis), destroying your
neighborhoods and nature for selfish gain is good (strip-mining, 
clearcutting, NAFTA, etc), and that other people don't matter as you
selfishly push your way to the top ... Is it any wonder that Johnny
ganked his classmate's new Nike sneakers when you've shown him how
you've ganked your business partners so you can afford that fancy  new
car? (and then conveniently say -- "nothing personal, it's just
business!")

Everything's personal!

Some children can rise above the lies and the sickness of what "being
American" is all about. They see through the sham of consumerism and
note that thoughtless consumption and reckless pursuit of personal
freedom only comes at the expense of others caught behind you in your
exhaust. When enough people are barreliing down the road to individual
freedom, we all end up living in everybody's exhaust, and everything
becomes a shithole. So start thinking about that before one points and
makes fun of those one or one's forebears left in the shithole. They're
fighting and pushing their way up and out just like one's forebears
did, and one may get hurt in the process, just like one might have hurt
them... it's real easy and convenient for one to talk about "stopping
the violence" when one is sitting pretty in your gated master-planned
suburban community, watching the desparate antics of the riff-raff on
"Cops" or "True Stories of the Highway Patrol"... And no, saying "there
ougtta be a law" isn't going to help the situation. It's just another
wall between you and them, and every wall eventually comes tumbling
down.

Realize we're all in this ghetto together. Better make the best of it.

First of all, thank you Monty for you rational and articulate post (this 
type of post seems to be becoming an endangered species on this list). 

On Tue, 25 Feb 1997 Tekno313@aol.com wrote:

> 
> In a message dated 2/24/97 8:03:53 PM, you wrote:
> 
> << I think people have misunderstood understood my terminology of "Ghetto
> Children". This term was created to summarize a specific type of person.
> A person who comes to a party souly to destroy the love we all share. To
> hurt for  the soul purpose of self gratification. Some people may
> understand what I mean if they have experienced what I am referring
> about.<<
> 
> This logic is, at best, extremely flawed and I would go so far as to say that
> you are now re-defining your original definition of who you believe "Getto
> Children" are. If this is your real idea of who and what constitutes a
> "Getto" child, tell me how the word getto plays a role in the definition
> itself. My interpretation of how you define "getto" is that you are using
> that word as code for racist/ethnocentrist sentiment. Not to mention your use
> of the word "Bitch" in reference to the two WOMEN who were on the phone at
> the house party you attended(But it's my understanding that you'll be
> schooled on that a little later too, so hang tight!).  
> 
> Phred went to great lenghts to educate us all with his earlier post so I wont
> further elaborate on that subject specifically. But I would like to take this
> time to address something that I feel is vital to discuss.
> 
> I am continually amazed at how people on this list refuse to believe that
> issues of race/class/gender have no place on SFR, yet virtually every week,
> we're dragged into this debate in some form or another. I strongly believe
> that we as     
> a House Nation will never truly progress as a movement until we can recognize
> and overcome these basic obstacles. If not, how are we any different than
> those who are on the outside, looking in, who we wish to change?  While we
> preach peace, love, unity, etc., we do absolutely nothing to facilitate the
> realization of these things here on this list and more importantly, in and
> around the dancefloor and in our everyday lives.  And I know it's possible
> too. It can be done.  Ask anyone who went to Freedom '93,  when for a few
> moments, it seemed as though the whole history/future of the SF Dance scene
> could have 
> been destroyed within minutes, but with the love, dedication and  sense of
> responsibility of the people in attendance, they turned a potentially
> catastrophic event into one of the greatest triumphs I have ever personally
> witnessed. Inspring moments like that are why I do what I do today.  
> But what
> about the present? What are we doing to bring about real and positive change
> so that the Kermit's of the world come to understand the concepts of basic
> human understanding, concepts that are fundamental to the Dance Music
> Community on the west coast? I think we have to go beyond stuff like eternal
> flame wars like the one we're involved in now to find the answers.  

The key is to try to respond to posts like Kermit's in a rational and calm 
way (wait a little while) and try to help him to understand why what he 
said was offensive.  I am just using Kermit as an example. 

> My last concern is list-related.  I havent been here that long, but I can't
> help but think that a lot of that discussion here is totally out of line and
> I beleieve something should be done about it.  I'm not saying these people
> should be censored, I dont really know what I'm saying here.  People who are
> admistrators on this list, Brian, etc., would it make sense to issue warnings
> to people in situations like this?  Am I totally out of line here? someone
> with some real experience here should respond to this.  

I think the main problem here is a lot of people posting without thinking 
for two seconds.  People are really not thinking about the fact that what 
they post is going to be read (maybe, if not deleted first) by 400+ 
people (most of whom they do not know) of diverse backgrounds and 
philosophies and ages.  We cannot continue to be so flippant about what 
we post to the list.  Even when we are very careful, we run the risk of 
offending someone; just think how that risk increases if we do not think 
before we post.  Everyone who has been flamed on this list knows that it 
was most likely due to the fact that they posted quickly, without 
thinking first.  People are all pretty quick to jump on the bandwagon to 
point it out, too; which is not so great either.

I am really not against new people joing our little microcosm of a list, I 
just hope that they would try to show the respect that they seem to spout 
about all the time in PLUR and in their sigs.  Learn what respect means.  
Look it up.  Think about the way they would like to be treated by others.  
Another suggestion I would give new people to the list is to read the
sfraves archives, which are located on the hyperreal web page 
(www.hyperreal.com).  They will give you a good background on the 
discussions that have come up on the list, as well as the things people 
post that tend to cause a lot of problems and misunderstandings.

Here's to increasing respect and responsibility.

cheers***
Cami
 
> Respect, 
> Monty

people you expect to and often see at the larger parties: "thugs." -- This
description seems to have more of a "not nice people" feeling attached to
it than a specific race or class like some people thought "gangsters"
thought did.

>I love kermit dearly
>he is a very very good friend of mine
>stop twisting his words!!!!!
>his ghetto children refered not to people who live in the ghetto.
<snip>

then why is he using the term "ghetto" in the first place???

seriously, I know from personal experience that if you're not careful what
you say on sfraves, you're going to get jumped on. (figuratively, of
course) This, IMHO, is not the fault of the jumpers but the person whose
sloppy and imprecise speech caused the problem in the first place.

Kermit's references to Ghetto Children may not have been intended as
racist, but the fact is that this society and this list equate the term
"ghetto" with very specific and very valid race issues, and Kermit was
stupid to have thrown out language like that without thinking of the
consequences of hiw words. Now, he's gettin' his and instead of opening his
mind and realizing that his choice of words may have been less than
perfect, he's just arguing and fighting more and more... sort of a sign of
immaturity if you ask me.

If he wanted to say there were bad-vibey people there, he could've just
said that without bringing some very loaded language into play.

-m.

I heard this announced on David McBernie's excellent World Music show
on KPFA (94.1) this morning.

Bally Sagoo (w/ others, including DJ Cheb I Sabbah)
Feb 27 (i think)
1015 Folsom 
Tix available at Reckless Records (SF) and somewhere else that I didn't write
info: 415 552 3778

I have Bally Sagoo's CD "rising from the east" (well, actually, I made
a digital copy on DAT before giving it as a gift to my sister) and it's
pretty cool sounding. Basically hip-hop but with East Indian influences
replacing the african-american orientation of hip hop. Some people call
this Bhangra, though I find Bally Sagoo's CD to be more hip-hop
sounding than Bhangra. THere's even an attempt at doing an
Indo-influenced House track (which is ok).

Chapati? Yeah, we pati'd all night!

How To Test For Thugs ( WARNING: Possibly Harmful To Tester!!! )

1. Approach the group of males to test for thug-ness.
2. Hug the meanest looking ( if you're a guy ) or the horniest
   looking ( if you're a gal ) - if you're a guy in drag, make
   your own choice.
3. If they just laugh and smile, then they are not thugs ( at least 
   in your case. Care to give me some make-up hints? ). 
4. If , instead, you find yourself immediatley in a veeery bad
   situation - well, I warned you, so Tough Shit (TS).

5. hug + TS = Thugs

Aw shucks, I couldn't resist this one...  According to the OED, here is
part of the etymology of 'thug':

" One of an association of professional robbers and murderers in India,
who strangled their victims;"

Does this not call our terminology into question?


(okay, okay, splitting hairs n' all... I will now return to my auto-erotic
erudition ;)

On 02/25/97 10:47:44 Niles wrote:

>Basically, these (Kermit and Paul) idiots pissed me off enough that
>I've added them to my mail-filter because I will feel the need to flame
>them otherwise, and I have better things to do with my time, and the
>readers of SFR could probably do without the negativity these creeps
>are inspiring in me. So I will never see mail from anybody with PLUR in
>their e-mail address, or his lamo tadpole friend. Happy, hungry,
>healthy mailfilter. I gave Paul a fair chance given his hateful
>rantings about homies and hoes a few months ago -- he clearly doesn't
>get it and I don't need to waste valuable diskspace on his blather.


	I have been folowing this thread since it began.  I also believe that these kids are 
totaly in the wrong dimension on this issue, infact it is my opinion that the redefine the 
apitamy of hipocricy.  But is it fair for us to just add all of them to the "filter" without 
giving them a chance to show us, and prove to themselves that they can grow out of their 
ignorance and learn to understand their mistakes, and use them as examples to teach others.

	If we ostrisize them and let our own frustration and outrage dictate our actions, how are 
we beter then them.  Ignorance is a wierd thing.  They show ignorance with their inexcusable 
assumptions, generalizations and prejudices with their slang and volgarity.  But we show them 
the same with our outrage and flaming, and never give them a chance to show that they can learn 
by adding them to a "filter"  It is rather arogent on our part. 

Shit roles down hill.   

We need to give everybody a chance.

Education is a more promising tool for change and positive development than a "filter"

	Lets see if they grow up, or not.  I personaly find it very ammusing.  It is incredible to 
see exactly to what extent someone with a "know it all" atitude and a low level of life 
experience will go to to prove a point.   

	It's kinda funny, but years from now, Paul and kermit and others like them will be siting 
around asking themselves "how could we have been so blatently ignorant and called ourselves 
ravers???!!??"

	Anyways, just food for thought.

Keep It Real

Ray Vonie.

After reading all 200+ messages about GhettoCHildren, Ravers
and such, I relalized something...

Its all about understanding. The only reason we don't like HomieG's, its
because we don't udnerstand them. Its like they have their OWN culture
(much like we ravers) and we just don't understand them. the same way they
don't understand us...

The reason I bring this up, is because at PNY, as I walked down the hallway
to
go outside after freaking out in the jungle room, this ghettoguy stops me
and asks me
if he can touch my fur coat... I said "Of course!.." and instead of just
letting him touch it, I gave him a hug...

It was a weird experience, since he didn't know what to do... and I didn't
know how he would take it. but it was all good!. He didn't say anything and
the hug didn't last very long, but after 30secs he said: "your coat is da
shit" and smiled while quickly turning his head to pretend he wasn't
looking anymore... he was with this girl, who
even though was a Ghetto type girl, she was 'dressed' up for a r ave, and
she smiled at me. so she obviously was one of those people who are there as
a link between our world and their world....

I walked back torwards them a minute later and gave them both some
Blow-Pops 
I had borrowed from Eric ;o) (thanks Eric). It was a very new experience,
yet
rewarding...

:o)
Pab

To enhance what Vertigo+APril said even more ;o) ..

The party overall was Evil and freaky, it was like being in a horror movie.
(totally, I walked down the jungle room, looking around, people passed out
on the wet dirty floor, people with their heads down (obviously having a
bad trip) no smiles, it was
a world of darkness and negativity...but outside, it was something else, it
was
like Recycling... People from inside would come for a walk outside with
frowns upn their faces, and we would make sure they had a SMILE before
going back in :o)

Received: from uscmg2.us.dhl.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.8.4/V2.0) with ESMTP id NAA22843; Tue, 25 Feb 1997 13:45:45 -0800 (PST)
Received: from csdev1.us.dhl.com (root@csdev1.us.dhl.com [199.41.128.24])
	by uscmg2.us.dhl.com (8.8.5/8.8.5) with ESMTP id NAA24144
	for <sfraves@hyperreal.com>; Tue, 25 Feb 1997 13:45:09 -0800 (PST)
Received: from milkman (virgo.us.dhl.com [199.41.137.175]) by csdev1.us.dhl.com (8.7.5/8.7.3) with SMTP id NAA02156 for <sfraves@hyperreal.com>; Tue, 25 Feb 1997 13:45:06 -0800 (PST)
Message-ID: <33135DE7.55FF@tgrigsby.com>
Date: Tue, 25 Feb 1997 13:47:19 -0800
From: SDream <SDream@tgrigsby.com>
Reply-To: SDream@tgrigsby.com
X-Mailer: Mozilla 3.0 (WinNT; U)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: From Me to You - Rave Haiku
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

An empty warehouse
Silent but for the murmurs
of happy ravers.

I turn to the crowd
place the needle on the wax
and crank up the bass.

Explosion of sound
Lasers ripping the chill night;
the Dance has begun.

Circle dancers spin.
Glo-sticks flash sick green lightening;
music warping minds.

Music pounds their souls,
ripping frenzied screams from them,
releasing, freeing.

I slow the fever
I pull the music down now
to touch their faces

Fade in faster beats
Machine gun fire snare drum
Bursting with a BOOM

Pounding again now,
the people freak to my beats...
the trance rewards them.

Your skin is prickling
I'm prying open your mind
scooping up your thoughts

Machines without souls,
the turntables play the souls
cut into vinyl.

Years of poetry
become a single moment
of hedonism.

People come to me
Hugs, sweet acceptance and joy,
Smiles, stickers, candy.

I pour it all back,
weaving tunes for my family,
my beloved friends.

Time blows soft away
Sweat, water, wet vibrations
Blasting ocean beats...

The music flows on
A stream carrying the sun
Light flowing upward

The light returning
Ravers, like stars, disappear
Just a few remain.

Finally, no more
the music fades to grey dust
Clapping my payment

An empty warehouse
Silent but for the murmurs
of happy ravers.

BTW, not to detract from from the controversy de jour, but did anyone
happen to pick up the San Francisco Chronicle and check out page B1? 
The headline:

	Prayer Party - Techno Mass Rocks Religious in Oakland

It pictures Ron Pilato and Lynn Stone.  Now, forgive me if my memory is
failing me, but don't we have a Lynn Stone online here?  Also, this
article seems to be about a post-denominational Rave church!  Yup,
that's right, now it's more than a music genre, it's a RELIGION!!!

YES i am mentioning godawful drugs on here. 
;)
I have a little question. I have a friend, see.. and he was on 4 hits of 
E on Saturday night, and he seemed to be able to control it, except for one 
thing. 
HIS EYES KEPT ROLLING INTO THE BACK OF HIS HEAD.
like, literally. he even told me a number of times, "I can't see." 
Now I know what 1-2 hits of E does to MY body but i would NEVER want to 
know 
what 4 hits would do. I don't know how it affects my friend, I can't 
feel what he's feeling,but when he's walking around, holding perfect 
conversations in this state, you would think he is ok. BUT 4 hits of E 
that's ALOT of chemicals fucking up your brain.. So here's what I'm 
trying 
to ask..
What's up with this eye-rolling thing? Is this a sign that I should 
get him some help? I was sitting there watching him going "oh shit 
he's gonna pass out".. If i had seen him from across the room I 
woulda been like "DAMN! he's still alive?" cuz all you could see most 
the time was the whites of his eyes. But, he was otherwise completely 
functional.. I hate being such a worrier, especially now. He's okay 
right now and all (i.e. not on 4 hits of E, or i should HOPE he 
isnt!), 
but 
should I have done something for him? How close is he to.. well 
passing out, or leaving us for good when his eyes roll abck like 
that? ive seen it happen before, but you shoulda seen him.. if he 
hadn't been talking and whatnot, i would have done something. but he 
seemed 
to be ok.. 
i'm going in circles about this whole thing (obviously) and would 
like 
to know for future references what to do if i ever come across him or 
anyone else's whites of their eyes. 
on a lighter note, see you all at ohmnisonic and warmth this weekend! 
8)~ smooches!
love and hugs,
lara

   If I remember correctly, just a few, short months ago a flame war was
started that scared off some of the most frequent posters.  I didn't step in
until the very end, and by that time it was too late.  Before we lose
subscribers, whether they like to post or not, let's think about what we're
writing.  Not if it has anything to do with raving, but just if it is
offensive or tasteless in general.  Stating your opinion is one thing, but
flat-out insulting someone for the whole list to read is quite another.  I'm
not notorious for long posts, or even very insightful ones.  However,
something even of this size has to mean I had something important to say, so
please don't just ignore it.  I can skip over and delete negative messages
with the best of them, but if I can convince just a few people to help spread
more PLURry messages, than that will help.  Let's not let this get out of
hand, and maybe start in on some more uplifting topics.  It's not a big
problem yet, but it could become one.  Thank you for your time.

           hugs,
            'trice                                 <<<<RAVEON>>>>

>Comments:

>ghetto. There is nothing un-plurish with the truth.

ghet-to   n. 1. In certain European cities, a section to which Jews were
formerly restricted.   2.  Any section of a city to which many members of
some minority group live, or to which they are restricted as by economic
pressure or social discrimination.

It's called nystagmus.  It's a side effect of MDMA.  Check the
Hyperreal drug archives for more side effect info and dosage warnings.
This seems like an extreme case.

And here's a nystagmus information page (not related to MDMA side
effects).

http://www.btinternet.com/~lynest/nyhome_n.htm=20

On Tue, 25 Feb 1997 Tekno313@aol.com wrote:
> My last concern is list-related.  I havent been here that long, but I can't
> help but think that a lot of that discussion here is totally out of line and
> I beleieve something should be done about it.  I'm not saying these people
> should be censored, I dont really know what I'm saying here.  People who are
> admistrators on this list, Brian, etc., would it make sense to issue warnings
> to people in situations like this?  Am I totally out of line here? someone
> with some real experience here should respond to this.  

Comments "as a list administrator" will just get ignored, or "who the f---
are you to tell me what to say or not say?" contested.  I've written a
number of the folks privately recently and gotten both of those two
responses.  

Warnings are useless because I am opposed to the idea of kicking someone
off the list, since the first thing they'll want to do is resubscribe
using a different AOL screen name or whatever, which I have no way to
guard against.  

My thoughts these days have leaned towards setting up a moderated mirror
of the list and somehow hacking majordomo to allow for multiple
moderators, with safeguards against two moderators approving the same
message.  If someone knows their way around majordomo and wants to hack
that in, drop me a line.  

	Brian

--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--

WARNING: FLAMING MATERIAL!!!

posting ten messages in a row and thirty a day to sfraves is incredibly
RUDE.  the fact that there was NOTHING worth reading in ANY of them is
beyond rude - it it immature, moronic, and asinine.  until you have
something interesting to say, please SHUT THE FUCK UP.

when i go to a party, i expect that there may be high-schoolers running
about dressed as muppets, staring vacantly around and saying "OHMYGOD,
I'm CANDYFLIPPING and you're my NEW BEST FRIEND!"  in person, this is
amusing and sometimes even endearing.  when this sort of crap arrives in
my mailbox by the dozen, demanding my TIME and ATTENTION, it is only 
infuriating.

here on sfraves, every time you post you are DEMANDING time out of the
lives of 400+ other people, who unlike you do not spend their days/daze
being bored at school.  grow up and show some consideration, even if you
apparently can't show any intelligence.

btw, your claim that your RACIST and SEXIST terminology is not so, because
you don't mean these words the way other people do, is simply stupid.
those words are abstract symbols - they only have meanings BECAUSE people 
conventionally agree on a particular meaning.  people who randomly
redefine words are babbling idiots.  think about that.

p.s.
don't bother to accuse me of reading a sentence or two of your mail and
then jumping down your back.  until now i have actually read your
blitherings, perhaps because i hoped you would reveal that this has all
been just a bad joke.

On Tue, 25 Feb 1997, Matthew Kodama wrote:
> until now i have fought the good fight, not using filters because i think
> they're implicitly anti-social.  but, i think the time has come to give
> up.  this new pack of fools is simply too much for human endurance.  so-
>  ***
> would those of you who know of good unix email filter software give me tip
> on where to find info (esp for elm readers)?

The two most commonly used ones are "filter" (part of the elm
distribution) and "procmail".  If your unix box is using Qmail instead,
qmail has its own built-in filtering mechanisms, see "man dot-qmail".  

	Brian

brian@hyperreal.com     http://www.apache.org     http://www.organic.com/jobs

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


Hi all!  ]=)

 Someone just recently asked about list moderation and I just wanted to 
add a little something (I consider this rave related as it concerns this 
list).

 My very favorite aspect of SFraves is it's "seeming" chaotic structure. 
While there is a guidelines list it is cheerfully ignored by most. While 
this list is supposed to be about raves _many_ other topics (most only 
remotely related to raves) are discussed freely and somtimes for days.

 I say "seeming" as the list is like a life form in that is self-regulating. 
For me, the oppertunity to develop communication skills here is 
dreadfully appealing. And what a place it is! The diversity is sometimes 
overwhelming!! And while certain thematic "links" are formed by 
individuals with the same outlooks, it is so much fun to jump from camp 
to camp in ways that can not be done anywhere else

 I like a situation where I can fuck up badly, be called on it, with no 
damage done except to my ego (well, for the most part ;). I enjoy being 
flamed (ducking!), flaming others, supporting others and just generally 
running around here and having a good time.

 I would like to thank all of you out there who have taken the time to 
respond to any of my posts! THANKS!!! I love SFraves!!!!  =)

 I really appreciate the freedom that SFraves has given to many of us.

smiles,

Ran D.Dreams



                                      (Namaste)
                                         /
                                   -=*=-/
                                     ~

Fred Heutte wrote:

>This is an important issue -- how we talk to each other and the terms we
>use.  I don't think anyone here really condones this kind of abuse of the
>language and sloppy thinking.  The question is, how do we deal with it?
>Online "communities" are fragile and easily sidetracked and even destroyed
>by carelessness, cluelessness and malice.

>We all have our residual prejudices.  The only shame is in not dealing with
>them and using what we learn to help others.  It is not a nice process,
>a happy process.  It is a necessary process.

Well said Fred.

You're words are 100% the way I think that most people on this list feel, 
but are reluctant to post.  Unfortunately though, there are a lot of 
careless words being thrown around this list regarding the Cool World party 
as well as nearly every other topic.  I don't think that some people realize 
the depth of this list, and how many people actually read and are affected 
by their words.

As far as the changing times on this list...yes, things have changed a great 
deal.  Not only sfraves, but the entire dance music/underground rave 
culture, and it will continue to do so.  The important thing for all of us 
to do, is to take these changes in stride.  Remeber that we are not all 
alike, that there are as many differences in people as there are people 
themselves.  After all, we are all on a similar path, we are all of the same 
culture, and we are all in this together, like it or not.  We need to 
realize that what things are true for the individual, are true for the 
whole.  I cannot consider myself a truly spiritual person if I shut out 
those who are not like me.

By calling someone "Ghetto Bitch" or "Racist", one merely succumbs to the 
negative aspects of their own energy.  Someone can get their point accross 
very well without the need to use words of this severity.

Maybe Kermit's intentions were negative ones, maybe they were not, but by 
replying to his post with more negativity only contributes to that 
negativity, thus fanning the flame even more.

I do not agree with Kermit's choice of words, or attitude toward those 
"Ghetto Children" or his attitude toward  people who have replied to him.  I 
also do not agree with the attitude and choice of words of those who posted 
the replies.  However, if we are to continue with discussions like these, in 
a public forum, we each must remember to treat one another with the respect 
that we all deserve.  If someone wishes to call me or anyone else an 
asshole, fine, that's their perogative, but do it privately, don't spread 
that negativity accross a whole sfraves list that hundreds of people will 
read.

There is no peace, love, unity or respect in these types of posts.

IMHO-Thanks for listening,

Smiles,

Scott =)

p.s.-I just read a post about someone thanking someone else for being on 
"their side" in this issue.  There are no sides here, we are all on the same 
side...we are all trying to reach happiness and understanding, in whatever 
that might take.  Lets not make these things personal.

Please read the definition of a ghetto and we can have a conversation.

Does your mom or you live in a ghetto?  The answer is NO.  You may live
near a ghetto, everyone in Sf does.  But that is a far cry from actually
being and living in one.  My point is made....NEXT!

>She is not in it, but we know many of the people who are.

So you spend alot of time there, visiting, spending the night, yes?

rationalize it = sexist.

respresentative of the culture which they were sprung.  We bring our own
ideals and our own predjudices with us everywhere we go.  The challenege is
to recognize the, er, 'bad' or negative parts of our perosnality and strive
to work on them.  THis is not required for memebership in the human race,
but if we were to practice it, I beleive we would have a much more peaceful
planet.

Nope, ravers are ravers, and they may very well be sexist and or racist.
Raving cures nothing, especially social ills such as racism and sexism.  As
a matter of fact, it may certainly spawn these attitudes (look at where
women are in the scene today...second class status.  Sad but very, very,
true).

Ok I've GOT to know:

This scene, from my totally unscientific analysis, is literally filled with
those OTHERS.  You know, Aquarians & Capricorns.  Many if not most of the
DJ's, Promoters, and personalities are this sign.  I've checked.  Now the
funny thing is I know that there are Pisces out there, after all, where
else would all the positivity come from.  Where else would the near freaky
energy come from.

the time is now my brothers and sisters to be counted.  Besides I am
curious.  E-mail me privately and let me know if you're one of us, a
Pisces.  Creative, Articulate, Loving, Fond Of Inebriation, Empathetic, and
of course Excellent Lovers (but we don;t talk about it much).  Oh yeah, did
I mention flighty (other sign characterization of us, but we know that
flexibility is a sign of an active mind!).

So stand up and be counted, besides, I wanna know!

One point.  There is usually a Pisces party thrown by Dj Buck.  I'm gonna
try to contact him and see if he has any plans for this year, now that he's
back.

Me: 3/17/xx (after all, xx marks the spot).

Pisces,
John

P.S.  I like the other signs too, but Pisces, oh my Pisces.  There is
something special about us.

On Tue, 25 Feb 1997 TeKnODiVa@aol.com wrote:

>    If I remember correctly, just a few, short months ago a flame war was
> started that scared off some of the most frequent posters.  I didn't step in
> until the very end, and by that time it was too late.  Before we lose
> subscribers, whether they like to post or not, let's think about what we're
> writing.  Not if it has anything to do with raving, but just if it is
> offensive or tasteless in general.  Stating your opinion is one thing, but
> flat-out insulting someone for the whole list to read is quite another.  I'm
> not notorious for long posts, or even very insightful ones.  However,
> something even of this size has to mean I had something important to say, so
> please don't just ignore it.  I can skip over and delete negative messages
> with the best of them, but if I can convince just a few people to help spread
> more PLURry messages, than that will help.  Let's not let this get out of
> hand, and maybe start in on some more uplifting topics.  It's not a big
> problem yet, but it could become one.  Thank you for your time.
> 
>            hugs,
>             'trice                                 <<<<RAVEON>>>>
>

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Wed Feb 26 11:01:48 1997
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.8.4/V2.0) id LAA14959; Wed, 26 Feb 1997 11:01:48 -0800 (PST)
Received: from x12.boston.juno.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.8.4/V2.0) with ESMTP id LAA14846; Wed, 26 Feb 1997 11:01:39 -0800 (PST)
Received: (from libbyrose@juno.com) by x12.boston.juno.com (queuemail)
	id NzA13596; Wed, 26 Feb 1997 13:59:26 EST
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: This is Libby's MOM!
Message-ID: <19970226.105816.14342.0.Libbyrose@juno.com>
X-Mailer: Juno 1.15
X-Juno-Line-Breaks: 0-1,8-9,14-15,20-21,26-27,29-31
From: libbyrose@juno.com (Libby Bundsen)
Date: Wed, 26 Feb 1997 13:59:26 EST
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Hi Everybody!  

I am Libby's Mom.  I recently attended my first rave (Euphonic Genesis in
San Jose.)  I was really impressed with how nice everybody was to me.  I
was worried some people would be put off by having parents there, but I
received lots of hugs, glitter, glowstix, and stickers to put on my face.
 Thanks to Paula for the bracelet, Sandra for the stickers, and Colleen
for loaning me her glowstick, and for everyone who gave me hugs and a
warm welcome.

I thought I wasn't going to enjoy myself, but outside of the music being
too loud, I had a good time.  (I should point out I am a musician, so
that is something for me to think the music was too loud.)   The artwork
was very good, even Libby's aluminum foil covered star.  (We aren't the
most artistic family.)

I am not a big-crowd type of person, so decided to step outside for a few
minutes to get some fresh air and give my ears a rest.  I got outside
just in time to see the cops pull up.  I thought, now wouldn't this be
something if the party got busted and I got arrested, but it turned out
to be a just noise complaint (I can understand why.)

I was happy to see there weren't  very many people stoned, not at least
while I was there.  Being in the medical profession, it makes me feel
really bad to see kids brought into the ER having bad trips, getting
sick, even dying.  There is a better way---you just have to find what
works for you.  For me it is playing music.  

Take good care of yourselves and remember there are adults who care about
and love you.  

Hugs to all of you....................Jenny  (Libby's Mom)

>From www.kntv.com 

POT CLUB IN SAN JOSE
 A Cannabis Club is set to open in San Jose next month. Proponents of the 
group which
 would supply marijuana for medicinal use made the announcement before 
the City Council
 last night. The council granted Robert Niswonger a business license to 
open the club on Race
 Street near Park Avenue. Prosecutors and San Jose Police say they treat 
the club as though it
 were a pharmacy opening in midtown. The law requires customers to have a 
prescription from
 their doctors.

Subject: NRR:Lunar astrology...interested?
Message-ID: <Pine.SUN.3.91.970226202845.15010C-100000@ese.UCSC.EDU>
