If a company is interested in me I ask them if they do drug testing.  If
they answer "yes" I will not take the job.  If more people did this, then
this unconstitutional, insulting, and highly offensive invasion of our
rights might stop.

Think about it: do you want to be working for a place where people think
drug testing is a good idea?

Note: I don't even drink alcohol, so I have no problem with passing.  I
have a moral objection to it.

At 12:21 AM 2/28/97 -0800, Ryan NEwEll wrote:

>I dunno if you're serious about this, but this is just too funny! I don't
>think people get spun off coffee and start firing people. People get fired
>for reasons. If anything, that cup of coffee is better for one's thinking,
>especially if they just woke up in the morning. 

Actually, scientific research has shown that caffeine *decreases* one's
ability to perform memorization and other mental tasks.  Adequate sleep,
good food, good vitamin/amino/herbal supplements, and daily exercise works
so much better than pounding Mountain Dew used to (I drank several cans a
day in college).

I have found that riding my bicycle to work is a _much_ better wakeup call,
doesn't tear up your stomach, and saves going to the health club (how many
people do you see _driving_ to a health club where they proceed to sit on
the stationary cycle for half an hour?)  Not to mention getting me in shape
to bounce around to drum and bass for hours.

Sorry if this seems self-righteous but it really does work for me.

// grigsbeast

Paul Hayden wrote:
> 
>                        Postage paid by: [Image]
> 
>     ---------------------------------------------------------------
> 
> Since I am broke and only have 3 bucks to my name I am going to go to a
> High School Dance. I am going (mildly) raved out. Bell botoms, ringer
> shirt, small backpack, bracelts, necklaces, whistles glasses,
> glowsticks.
> Wish me luck, I just may be the only raver there.
> Hey I know what yer thinking! :)
> But I am bored and my rave buddy is sick so. I am going to go circle
> dance at my school.
> Maybe i will bring a mixed tape to the DJ the school hired.
> Who knows turn my school dance into a rave.
> Love.Luck.Lollipops,
> Paul

Okay this is how the dance was you guys and this is vrey scary.
First I will list the bad aspects

BAD STUFF
---------------
*Music was same as radio
*DJ never mixed anything. He just let it play
*The (wanna be) house music sets were only 5 minutes long.
*I was the only raver there (scary)
*People were doing a lot of freaking
*People were drunk
*It cost $5

GOOD STUFF
----------------
* Vibes. Surprisingly enough the vibes were quite qood.
* I got props for dancing (like I care)
* No guys tried to start shit.
* Gangster guys and Jocks actually asked to borrow some of my neckalces
for times. ??????
* Everyone liked my clothes.
* I could breath properly

INTERSTING THINGS
---------------
* The DJ had wonderful equipment. Tecnics 1200.
* They would clap like they do at raves.
* Some other peole had whistles ???? They were off by far though
* I asked th DJ to play some house and he played some Prodigy!!

OVERALL
---------------
Overall I would say that i had more fun in that 1 hour than i had at a
lot of massives. That's a scary thought. When HS Dances become more fun
than raves that saids something bad for raves. It really concerns me
too. Thats's waht is very scary to me. Many rave promoters could learn
from my school about throwing a rave with a good vibe.

Love.Luck.Lollipops,
Paul
P.S. And yes I am still a raver. I am not a HS Dancer now :)

Hi all!  ]=)

 Wow! There is sure a lot of you folks!

 Anyway, I have been/am writing a play. It is based on a Greek tragedy, 
The Bakkhai by Euripedes. It (The Bakkhai) tells of the invasion of the 
City of Thebes by a Dionysian cult. The king of Thebes doesn't realise he 
is dealing with the god himself (Dionysus) and eventually dies (a Greek 
tragedy is distinguished by the death of an aristocat).

 My interpetation is based on a rave with the King of Thebes being Head of 
Security and Dionysus (the god of exctasy) being a DJ.

 The reason I'm telling so many is that my play development workshop 
class (at UCSC) is presenting a read through of my play. I can have 
guests be there and after the reading there is a feedback session from 
the observers. The process is designed to help me, as a writer, to 
rewrite the play if neccesarry (almost a guarentee).

 If anyone is interested in attending (it's free ;) it will be held at 4 
PM on March 5th at the UCSC Perorming Arts Complex in room B-100. It is 
an accademic setting and guests are expeced to respect the setting and 
facilities.

 Any questions?

hugz,

Ran D.Dreams
